Text File : 7

Welcome to Battle Competition!
There are two kinds of\nBattle Competitions.\c\nOne is the Wi-Fi Competition,\nwhich is held via Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection.\c\nThe other is the Live Competition,\nwhich is held at certain events.\c\nOnly Pokémon registered in your\nBattle Box can participate.\c\nOnce registered, you cannot move\nyour Pokémon to and from your\r\nBattle Box.\c\nWhen you participate in a competition,\nyour Digital Player ID will be updated.\r\nPlease check it.\c
To the Wi-Fi Competition
To the Live Competition
Check your Digital Player ID
Info
Back
Participate
To participate in the Wi-Fi Competition,\nyou'll need to access the webpage\r\nof the Pokémon Global Link to register.\r\nhttp://www.pokemon-gl.com\c\nPlease check the Pokémon Global Link\nwebpage for the competition regulations,\r\nits duration, and other information.\c\nPlease bear in mind that if the power is\nturned off during a Wi-Fi Competition or a\r\nRandom Matchup, you won't be able to\r\nparticipate in a competition for one hour.\c
Will you participate in\nthe Wi-Fi Competition?
                    
    
    
Cancel participation
Will you participate in\nthe Live Competition?
You can check the information\nregarding the Live Competition at the\r\nPokémon official website:\r\nhttp://www.pokemon.com.\c\nPlease check the Pokémon official website\nfor the competition regulations,\r\nits duration, and other information.\c
Since the system was turned off or lost\npower during a Wi-Fi Competition or\r\na Random Matchup, you cannot participate\r\nin a competition or a Random Matchup\r\nfor one hour.\c\nPlease come back again\nafter one hour has passed.\c
Saving...\nDon't turn off the power.
To recognize your achievement in battle,\nI present you with these Battle Points.\c
[VAR 0100(0000)] received\n[VAR 0201(0001)] BP!\c

About “Infrared"
About “Online"
About “Online"

About “Wireless"
About “Wireless"
About “Wireless"
About “Wireless"
About “Tag Log"
About “Tag Log"
About “Survey Radar"
About “Survey Radar"
About “Customization"
About “ON/OFF"
About “ON/OFF"
Using infrared, you can battle and trade\nwith a friend in front of you.\nYou can also use the Feeling Check, which\ntells you how compatible you and your\nfriend are, and exchange Friend Codes.
By pressing the Game Sync button,\nyou can select a Pokémon to make sleep\nand then send your saved data over\nNintendo Wi-Fi Connection.
You cannot connect to Nintendo Wi-Fi\nConnection without the proper\nsystem settings, even when you are\nable to receive a signal for\nNintendo Wi-Fi Connection.
DS Wireless Communications\nallow you to use the features below\nwith your nearby friends.\n-Xtransceiver\n-Entralink
The Xtransceiver allows you to connect\nwith friends you've played with in the\nWi-Fi Club or those you've exchanged\nFriend Codes with using the C-Gear.
Press the button, and you will be\nsent to the Entralink instantly.
You can tell how many people\nare in the Union Room around you\nand if wireless distributions\nare available nearby.
You can also tell who has\nthe C-Gear turned on around you.\nWhen people are nearby,\nit is easier to receive signals for\nthe Tag Log and Survey Radar.
It displays what people\naround you are doing in real time.\nBy selecting it, you can find out\nmore about them and send\nthem messages.
Also, when a Funfest Mission\nis being undertaken,\nthe phrase “FUNFEST MISSION!" will be\ndisplayed from right to left.\nYou can participate in the\nFunfest Mission from your Tag Log.
You can do surveys on people\naround you.\n\nChoose what you want to find out,\nand you can see the daily results,\nas well as the cumulative results.
When you finish a survey you received\nat the Passerby Analytics HQ,\nthe button starts blinking.\nReport the result to the leader\nin Castelia City.
Touch the Customization icon, and\nthe buttons will start blinking.\nTouch one of the buttons and drag it\nto change its position.\nAlso, you can touch rings to change\ntheir colors.
Touch this button to turn\nwireless communications on or off.\n\nOnce you turn it off, the Touch Screen\nturns dark, and wireless communications\nwill be turned off.
The C-Gear is\nautomatically turned off\nwhen the DS system is closed\nand the battery is low.

My name is Professor Juniper.\nEveryone calls me the Pokémon Professor!\c
That's right! This world is widely\ninhabited by mysterious creatures\r\ncalled Pokémon!\c
Pokémon have mysterious powers.\nThey come in many shapes\r\nand live in many different places.\c\nWe humans live happily with Pokémon!\nLiving and working together,\r\nwe complement each other.\c\nWe help each other out to\naccomplish difficult tasks.\c\nHaving Pokémon battle one another\nis particularly popular, and it deepens\r\nthe bonds between people and Pokémon.\r\nAnd that is why I research Pokémon.\c

Send and receive keys with\nPokémon Black Version 2 or\nPokémon White Version 2.\n\nSending and receiving keys\ncan unlock Key System settings\nand places on the map.
Change game settings\nwith Keys.\n\nKeys can be obtained by proceeding\nthrough your adventure. You can also\nunlock settings by trading Keys\nwith others.
Return to the main menu.

Change the difficulty.\nThe current mode is Normal Mode.
Change the difficulty.\nThe current mode is Challenge Mode.\nPokémon battles with Trainers\nare more difficult than normal.
Swap White Forest and\nBlack City.\nThis area is currently Black City.
Swap White Forest and\nBlack City.\nThe area is currently White Forest.
Go back to the Key System's main menu.

When you are playing, press the X Button\nto open the menu and save often.\n\nOnce saved, you can select “CONTINUE"\nfrom the main menu to continue playing\nthe game from that location even if you've\nturned off your Nintendo DS since.
To delete your saved data and\nstart a new game, go to the\ntitle screen and press the\nfollowing buttons at the same time.\n\nUP + SELECT + B Button
You can receive special gifts at events and\nother locations in the following three ways.\n\n-GET VIA WIRELESS\n-GET VIA NINTENDO WFC\n-GET VIA INFRARED\n\nPlease note that each event has its own way\nof distributing gifts.
When you receive a Wonder Card\nfor a special Pokémon or an item,\na deliveryman with a blue cap\nwill appear in the Pokémon Center.\n\nPlease talk to him to receive\nthe Pokémon or item.
You can keep up to 12 Wonder Cards.\n\nTo receive another Wonder Card\nwhen you already have 12, go to\n“CHECK THE CARD ALBUM"\nand delete one to make room\nfor a new Wonder Card.
You can participate in competitions\nusing Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection\nand at events.\n\nFor details on the Battle Competition,\ngo to “BATTLE COMPETITION"\non the main menu and select\n“Info."
For more details on Battle Competition,\nincluding Battle Competition rules and\nhow to register as a user,\nvisit the following official websites.\nPokémon Global Link website\nThe Official Pokémon website
Pokémon in your Battle Box\ncan participate in Battle Competitions.\n\nOnce registered, you cannot change\nthe Pokémon in your Battle Box\nduring the competition.\n\nPlease carefully select the right Pokémon\nbefore you start the competition.
To get Pokémon out of your Battle Box\nafter a Battle Competition, you need to\nunregister or end the competition.\n\nFor more details, visit the following\nofficial websites.\nPokémon Global Link website\nThe Official Pokémon website
Once you have completed\nthe registration for Battle Competition,\nyou will be able to check your\nDigital Player ID.\n\nFor more details, please visit\nthe Pokémon Global Link.
Before adjusting Game Sync settings,\nyou must complete your\nNintendo Wi-Fi Connection settings.\n\nWhen these settings are done,\nadjust the Game Sync settings\nto have the Game Sync ID issued.\nThis is a unique ID assigned to you.
You must have a Game Sync ID\nto register at the\nPokémon Global Link using\na computer with Internet access.
When you delete a saved game,\nyour Game Sync ID will also be lost.\n\nWhen you change your Game Sync ID,\nyou must also renew your registration\nat the Pokémon Global Link.
You can set up your Nintendo DS or\nNintendo DS Lite system for\nNintendo Wi-Fi Connection.\n\nOnce your Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection\nsettings are complete, you can trade\nand battle with people all over the world\nthrough the Internet.
You need to set up the Nintendo Wi-Fi\nConnection settings to connect your game\nwith the Pokémon Global Link, which allows\nBattle Competition, Game Sync settings,\nand so on.
You can check to see\nif your DS system's\nmicrophone is functioning.\n\nThe microphone is functioning properly\nif Jigglypuff on the top screen\nreacts when you talk\nor blow into it.
You can restore your tired Pokémon and buy\nuseful items. You'll find the PC where you\ncan keep captured Pokémon.\n\nYou can hear\nProfessor Juniper's evaluation\nof your Pokédex.\n\nVisit 2F for Link Trade and Link Battle.
You can use the PC to store and organize\nPokémon.\n\nWhen you have six Pokémon in your party,\nany Pokémon you catch will be sent to the PC.
You can move or relocate Pokémon stored\nin the PC to a Box you like\nusing “MOVE POKÉMON."
First, tap a Pokémon you want to move.\nThen tap “MOVE"\nto display Boxes on the right.\n\nSlide the stylus up or down on the gray arrow\nand tap the Box where you want to store the\nPokémon to move the Pokémon to that Box.
Tap the blue button to switch to\nthe Relocate Mode.\n\nSelect a Pokémon by tapping it, and slide it\nto the place you want to relocate it to.
Tap the yellow button to switch to\nthe Group Move Mode.\n\nTap on a Box to display a dotted square.\nSurround multiple Pokémon with the dotted\nsquare to move them all at once.
You can register up to six Pokémon\nyou use most often in battles.\n\nFor a Link Battle, you can choose to battle\nwith either your party Pokémon or with\nthe Pokémon in the Battle Box.\n\nIf your Battle Box is empty,\nyou always battle with your party Pokémon.
There are four ways to offer a Link Trade.\n\n-Through an IR Connection\n-Through the Union Room\n-Through the Wi-Fi Club\n-Through the Global Terminal
-Through an IR Connection\n\nIf your friends are nearby, IR Connection is\na quick way to trade.\n\nSelect IR from your C-Gear and select Trade.
-Through the Union Room\n\nWhen you are playing with lots of friends,\nyou can use the Union Room for trades.\n\nThe Union Room is in Pokémon Center 2F.
-Through the Wi-Fi Club\n\nWhen your friends are far away,\nyou can trade through the Wi-Fi Club.\n\nYou must have exchanged your Friend Codes\nahead of time to use the Wi-Fi Club.
-Through the Global Terminal\n\nUsing the Global Terminal, you can trade\nPokémon with people all over the world.\n\nWhen the trade conditions are met,\nyour Pokémon are traded automatically.
There are four ways to offer a Link Battle.\n\n-Through an IR Connection\n-Through the Union Room\n-Through the Wi-Fi Club\n-Through the Global Terminal
-Through an IR Connection\nIf your friends are nearby, an IR Connection\nis a quick way to battle.\n\nSelect IR from your C-Gear and select Battle\nfor a Level 50 Flat Battle with the\nWonder Launcher.
-Through the Union Room\n\nWhen you are playing with lots of friends,\nyou can go to the Union Room for battles.\n\nThe Union Room is located in Pokémon\nCenter 2F.
-Through the Wi-Fi Club\n\nWhen your friends are far away, you can\nbattle using the Wi-Fi Club.\n\nYou must have exchanged your Friend Codes\nahead of time to use the Wi-Fi Club.
-Through the Global Terminal\nUsing the Global Terminal, you can battle with\npeople all over the world using various rules\nto hone your skills.\n\nThe Global Terminal is located in Pokémon\nCenter 2F.
A battle where each Trainer chooses one\nPokémon to fight is called Single Battle.\n\nIncluding Single Battle, there are four kinds\nof battles.\n\nYou can always press the A Button\nwhile holding down the L Button to\nread move information when choosing a move.
Having a battle with two Pokémon from each\nTrainer is called Double Battle.
A battle with three Pokémon from each\nTrainer is called Triple Battle.\n\nIn a Triple Battle challenge, Pokémon cannot\nattack others if they are too far away.\n\nThe one in the middle position can attack\nany of the other Trainer's Pokémon.
Some moves can reach Pokémon\neven when they are far away.\n\nYou can switch Pokémon locations\nduring battle.\n\nYou can select “SHIFT" while selecting\na move and the right or left Pokémon will\nswitch places with the middle Pokémon.
Rotation Battle is a new and evolved\nstyle of Single Battle.\n\nYou'll need three of your Pokémon\nfor Rotation Battle.\n\nOnly one Pokémon can act every turn,\nbut you choose which one takes action.
If you want to move a Pokémon to the front,\nselect the Rotation icon while selecting\na move.\n\nThe Pokémon will rotate to the front and\nwill use its selected move in the same turn.
When you select Wonder Launcher “ON,"\nyou and the other Trainer can use items\nduring a Link Battle.\n\nEach item has points needed to launch.\nYou'll gain points in battle.\n\nYou choose whether to use items immediately\nor collect points for powerful items.
In the Union Room, you can trade and\nbattle with people nearby.\n\nGo to Pokémon Center 2F and enter\nthe room to your left. Press the A Button\nto talk to anyone there.\n\nFor more information, talk to the lady\nat the far left in the Union Room.
At the Wi-Fi Club in Pokémon Center 2F,\nyou can make Link Trades, fight Link Battles,\nand use Voice Chat or the Xtransceiver with\npeople you've registered on your Pal Pad.\n\nRefer to the “FRIEND CODE" section\nof this guide to learn how to register\nyour friends.
Once in the room, press the A Button\nnear the friend you want to link to.\n\nYour friends who have decided what to do\nwill be jumping up and down while waiting.\n\nWhen you've decided what you want to do,\npress the A Button near the monitor\nat the far end of the room.
You can talk to your friends with Voice Chat.\nIt works like a telephone.\n\nPress the X Button in the room to indicate\nwhether you want to use Voice Chat or not.
At the Global Terminal, you can set up\nLink Trades and you can Link Battle with\npeople all around the world.\n\nGo to the right counter in Pokémon Center 2F.
This personal number is issued when you\nestablish a Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection.\n\nIf you exchange Friend Codes, you can battle\nand trade with friends far away.\n\nPlease check the Pal Pad in the Key Items\nin your Bag for your own Friend Code.
You can register a Friend Code in two\ndifferent ways.\n\n- Use the Pal Pad in the Key Items in your\n   Bag to enter your friend's Friend Code\n- Use an Infrared Connection from your\n   C-Gear
The C-Gear is a multifunctional device\nthat lets you use the Entralink,\nthe Xtransceiver, and Game Sync.\n\nYour C-Gear can also help you Link Trade\nand Link Battle with people nearby.\n\nTap the power icon in the bottom-right corner\nof your C-Gear to turn it on or off.
When your C-Gear is turned on, your\nDS system's wireless communications\nare always on.\n\nTurn your C-Gear off in places where\nwireless communications are prohibited,\nsuch as airplanes and hospitals.
Tap the wrench icon in the bottom-right\ncorner of the C-Gear to customize it.\n\nTap on a frame to change the color\nor slide a blinking button to move it\nto a place you like.\n\nTap the “?" icon for help with your C-Gear.
The rectangular icon in the center of your\nC-Gear is for the Tag Log. Tap it to see\npeople who are using their C-Gear around you.\n\nYou can see their profiles, tell what they\nare doing in the game, and exchange messages.\n\nAlso, when a Funfest Mission starts,\nit blinks to let you know.
When you see other players who have their\nC-Gear on, you can select them to see their\nplay time, location in the game,\nrank in Passerby Analytics, and more.
Tap the triangle icon at the bottom of\nthe Tag Log screen to use\na Pass Power received from your Entree.\n\nTo receive a Pass Power, check\nthe Entree in the Entralink.
Tap the speech-bubble icon to send messages\nto another player with his or her C-Gear\nturned on.\n\nNever send offensive messages or messages\nthat contain personal information such as\nnames and telephone numbers.
Tap the smile icon and you can send\na thank-you message.\n\nTap the icon and then select whom to thank.
Tap the Medal icon to see the number of\nMedals that the other Trainer received\nand the Favorite Medal he or she registered.
A Passerby Survey can tell you\nhow many people around you\nlike certain hobbies, for example.
You can accept Passerby Survey requests\nat the Passerby Analytics HQ in Castelia City.
When the leader asks you to take a survey,\ntap the pie-chart icon in the bottom-left\ncorner of your C-Gear to decide which survey\nto run.\n\nThe survey you are running will be marked\nin your list.
Once you've decided which survey to run,\njust turn your C-Gear on.\n\nThe survey will take place automatically\nas people pass by you.\n\nThe survey will continue even when your\nDS system is closed or when you are playing\nthe game.
Before you report to the leader in Castelia\nCity, check the results using “CHECK SURVEY\nRESULTS" in your C-Gear.\n\nOnce you know that the survey is complete,\ngo to Passerby Analytics HQ in Castelia City\nto report to your leader.
When you tap the framed “INFRARED" icon\non your C-Gear, you can enjoy Link Trade and\nLink Battle with people nearby.\n\nYou can also exchange Friend Codes and check\nhow close you are to someone else.
Select the same item and let your and your\nfriend's DS systems face each other to start\nthe connection.\n\nOnce they are connected, your DS systems\nno longer need to face each other.
When you tap the framed\n“ONLINE" icon on your C-Gear,\nthe Game Sync option will appear.\n\nGame Sync is a system to make a Pokémon in\nthe PC fall asleep and to send the saved\ndata of Trainers.
The color of the “ONLINE"\nicon's frame on your C-Gear changes\ndepending on the situation.\n\nIt is green when the\nNintendo Wi-Fi Connection settings\non the DS system are complete.
The frame of the “ONLINE" icon will\nbe blue when you are somewhere with a\nwireless access point that enables Nintendo\nWi-Fi Connection, such as a Nintendo Zone.
When you are near wireless access points\nbut your Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection settings\nare not complete, the frame of the\n“ONLINE" icon will be red.
The saved data sent through Game Sync\ngoes to the Pokémon Dream World.\n\nThe Pokémon Dream World is located\non the official Pokémon Global Link website.
To play in the Pokémon Dream World,\nyou must set up the following items:\n\n-Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection settings\n-Game Sync settings\n-User registration with your own computer\n  at the official website for\n  the Pokémon Global Link
You can go to the center of the Unova\nregion, called the Entralink, by tapping the\nframed “WIRELESS" icon\non your C-Gear.\n\nIn the center of the Entralink is a tree\ncalled the Entree.
Face the Entree and press the A Button\nto accept a Funfest Mission.\n\nMissions have different objectives.\nFor example, look for items or have Pokémon\nbattles within the time limit.
Points can be scored during missions.\nClear the target score to accomplish\nthe objective stated in each\nmission description.\n\nThe higher the score is,\nthe bigger the reward you receive\nwhen you accomplish the mission.
You can play Funfest Missions\nwith people near you.\n\nWhen someone starts a Funfest Mission,\nthe Tag Log starts blinking.\nTap it to participate in a Funfest Mission\nyou would like to join.
A Pass Power is a mysterious power you\nreceive from the Entree in the Entralink.\n\nPass Powers have various effects.\nSome can increase Exp. Points, some can\nincrease the chance to catch Pokémon,\nand so on. You can receive up to three\nPass Powers at once.
To use a Pass Power, tap\n“Tag Log" (in the center of\nyour C-Gear) while outside of\nthe Entralink and another screen will\nappear. Tap the triangle icon on the screen.\n\nTo use a Pass Power, you need a certain\nnumber of Pass Orbs.
As the Entree grows and levels up,\nyou can receive new Pass Powers.\n\nTo level up the Entree,\naccept Funfest Missions\nand get high scores.
You need to have a certain number\nof Pass Orbs to use your Pass Power.\n\nYou can obtain Pass Orbs by going to the\nEntree and participating in Funfest Missions.
■ Bag function\nYour Bag always sorts items by their types.\n\nItems in the Key Items Case\nhave checkboxes next to them.\n\nCheck the box to set up the item\nto use it by pressing the Y Button,\nwithout having to open your Bag.
Pressing the green icon on the Touch Screen\nor choosing one of the sort options displayed\nby pressing START sorts items in the Case.\n\nPressing SELECT allows you to change\nthe order of items in a Case freely.\nYou can switch between\npages with the L Button or R Button.
Your Bag has a “Free Space."\n\nFirst, choose an item in a Case.\nNext, select “Put in Free Space”\nto move the item to the Free Space.
■ Item types\n-ITEMS\nPokémon can hold some items to raise their\nstats or move power. Those items are marked.\n\nTry letting your Pokémon hold these items\nto see what effects they have.
There are some items you can use\nonly in a battle to raise Pokémon stats or\nmoves powers.\n\nSome items may last for a limited time.\nSome last until the Pokémon switches out.
The Poké Balls you need to catch Pokémon\nare kept in the ITEMS Case, as are items\nrelated to Pokémon evolution.\n\nYou can combine phrases and words\nto form Mail. Your Pokémon can hold Mail,\nand if you trade the Pokémon with\nyour friends, they can deliver your Mail.
-MEDICINE\nThis area holds items that restore\nyour Pokémon's HP and PP and heal\nstatus conditions.\n\n-TMs & HMs\nThis area holds your TMs & HMs.\nThey can be reused as often as you like.
-BERRIES\nThis holds Berries that create special\neffects when your Pokémon hold them\nor use them.\n\n-KEY ITEMS\nThis is a place to keep Key Items. You can\nassign some of them to the Ready button\nfor instant use.
Open the menu using the X Button, then\nselect your name to check your Trainer Card.\n\nYou can tap the icon in the bottom-left\ncorner of the Touch Screen to check\nhow many Gym Badges you have.
The Trainer Card displays your total\nplay time, prize money, and more.\nTap your title and characteristic to change\nthem, and select a new one you like.\n\nTap the greeting column underneath\nto edit your message. Fill in the boxes\nto complete your message.
You can sign the back of your card\nusing the stylus.\n\nTap the pen and eraser icons to switch\nbetween writing and erasing.\n\nTap the plus icon to magnify the screen.\nTap the triangle icon to split the signature\narea in two for animation.
As you progress in your adventure,\na Medal icon will be added to your\nTrainer Card.\n\nTap the Medal icon to see the Favorite Medal\nyou registered and the number of Medals\nyou have.
This high-tech Pokédex records Pokémon\nautomatically.\n\nYou can check a Pokémon's info, area, cry,\nheight, weight, type, footprint, and more.
Press “START" when the list is displayed\nin the Pokédex to activate the Search Mode.\n\nIn the Search Mode,\nyou can search Pokémon\nby number, alphabetical order,\nname, color, shape, and more.
As you progress in your adventure,\n“Habitat List" will be added to\nthe Pokédex.\n\nThe Habitat List displays Pokémon you met\nby location. When you have seen or caught\nall Pokémon living in a particular place,\na stamp mark will be added.
Your chances of capturing a Pokémon\nare better if you lower your target's HP\nbefore you throw Poké Balls.\n\nIf you use Pokémon moves to inflict a sleep\nor paralysis condition on the target,\ncapturing it will be even easier.
Pokémon and their moves fall into\n17 different types. Each type has\nits own advantageous and disadvantageous\nmatchups against the others.\n\nFor example, Fire-type moves are more\neffective against Bug- and Grass-type\nPokémon but are less effective against\nWater- or Rock-type Pokémon.
When the move type matches the type of the\nPokémon using it, the power of the move\nis greater than usual.\n\nWhen a Pokémon has two types, either one\ncan affect the power.\n\nSome move types have no effect at all\non Pokémon of certain types.
Moves are classified as Physical, Special, or\nStatus moves. You can tell which is which\nby their icons.\n\n-Physical Moves\nPokémon's Attack and Defense stats\ndetermine the overall damage of this type\nof move.
-Special Moves\nPokémon's Sp. Attack and Sp. Defense stats\ndetermine the overall damage of these types\nof moves.\n\n-Status Moves\nThis type of move is not a direct attack, but\nit can raise the Pokémon's stats and inflict\nstatus conditions that help them in battles.
The Pokémon's HP has reached zero.\nYou must restore its HP before\nit can battle again.\nSome of the moves usable outside battle can\nstill be used when its HP reaches zero.\n■ To heal your Pokémon:\n-Let Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Revive\n-Use Max Revive
The Pokémon has been poisoned.\nIts HP will gradually decrease in battle.\nThis will stop when it returns to its Poké Ball\nor when the battle ends, but the poisoned\nPokémon will not cure itself.\n\n■ To heal a poisoned Pokémon:\n-Let Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Antidote, Pecha Berry, etc.
The Pokémon has paralysis.\nIts Speed stat drops, and\nit sometimes fails to use moves.\nA Pokémon with paralysis will not\ncure itself.\n\n■ To heal a Pokémon with paralysis:\n-Let Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Parlyz Heal, Cheri Berry, etc.
The Pokémon is asleep. Only certain moves\ncan be used in this state.\n\nThe Pokémon can wake up during a battle, but\nit stays asleep if the battle ends before it\nwakes up.\n■ To heal a sleeping Pokémon:\n-Let the Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Awakening, Chesto Berry, etc.
The Pokémon is frozen and cannot use\nmost moves. It can be defrosted during\na battle, but it stays frozen if the battle\nends before it is defrosted.\n\n■ To heal a frozen Pokémon:\n-Let the Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Ice Heal, Aspear Berry, etc.
The Pokémon is burned.\nIts Attack stat drops, and its HP gradually\ndecreases. This HP loss stops when it returns\nto its Poké Ball or when the battle ends,\nbut the burned Pokémon will not\ncure itself.\n■ To heal a burned Pokémon:\n-Let the Pokémon rest at a Pokémon Center\n-Use Burn Heal, Rawst Berry, etc.
The Pokémon is confused.\nIt sometimes attacks itself instead of\nusing the selected move.\nIt is cured after the battle, and the Pokémon\ncan sometimes cure itself during a battle.\n\n■ To heal a confused Pokémon:\n-Switch out the affected Pokémon in a battle\n-Use Persim Berry, etc.
The Pokémon is infatuated\nby a Pokémon of the opposite gender.\nIt has a crush on the other Pokémon\nand sometimes fails to use its moves.\n\nIt will be cured when switched out\nor when the other Pokémon is defeated.
Pokémon earn Exp. Points\nafter a battle. They grow as they\nreceive Exp. Points and level up.\n\nThe stronger the Pokémon it defeats,\nthe more Exp. Points it earns.\n\nThe weaker the Pokémon it defeats,\nthe fewer Exp. Points it earns.
Exp. Points are shared among\nthe Pokémon in a battle. To help\na weak Pokémon receive Exp. Points,\ntake it out and switch in a strong Pokémon.\n\nWhen you trade and receive a Pokémon\nfrom another Trainer, it'll gain more\nExp. Points than Pokémon that\nyou've caught yourself.
Pokémon sometimes evolve.\nWhen they do, their appearance changes\nand their stats increase.\n\nThere are many ways to evolve.\nYou can evolve some Pokémon by leveling up,\nsome by using items that evolve Pokémon,\nand some by trading a Pokémon with a friend.\nEach Pokémon has its own way to evolve.
If you press the B Button while a Pokémon\nis evolving, it will be surprised\nand will stop evolving.\n\nYou can also obtain an item that\nprevents Pokémon from evolving.
Pokémon can grow differently,\ndepending on each one's Nature\nand Characteristic.\n\nSometimes Pokémon stats such as\nAttack and Defense may be colored\nred or blue. Red means the stat is\nmore likely to increase, and blue means\nthe stat is less likely to increase.
Pokérus is a beneficial virus seldom\nseen in Pokémon.\n\nPokémon that were once infected by Pokérus\nseem to grow faster.\n\nPokérus may spread to other Pokémon\nin your party.
When you leave two Pokémon\nat the Pokémon Day Care,\nyou may find an Egg.\n\nTake an Egg with you in your party, along with\nyour other Pokémon, and a Pokémon will hatch\nfrom the Egg.
Once you've received the Running Shoes,\npress the B Button to run.
The Dowsing MCHN can indicate where items\nare hidden on the Touch Screen.\n\nFollow the directions to find them. When\nyou stand on a hidden item, it will blink.\n\nYou cannot pick up items if you are standing\ndirectly on them. Step away, face toward\nthe hidden item, and press the A Button.
This item lets you talk to your friends\nusing DS Wireless Communications\nor Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection.\n\nWith a Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo DSi, or\nNintendo DSi XL, you can use the camera\nto see each other while talking.\nYou must both register Friend Codes before\ntalking with friends on the Xtransceiver.
■ Using DS Wireless Communications\nTouch the “WIRELESS" button on your C-Gear\nto select the Xtransceiver.\nThe names and ID numbers of Trainers\nyou've exchanged Friend Codes with\nwill appear on the Touch Screen.\nSelect the people you want to talk to\nand give them a call. You can call\nup to three people at once.
The “WIRELESS" button on your C-Gear will\nflash, and the C-Gear will ring.\n\nThe Xtransceiver will show your friend's name.\nTap it to pick up the phone.\n\nYou will not be able to answer if you tap\nthe Xtransceiver.
■ Using Wi-Fi Club\nYou can talk to one Trainer in the Wi-Fi Club.
■ How to Use the Xtransceiver\nUse the Touch Screen. Touch the button\nin the middle while you are talking into it.\n\nUse the gauge to your left to change\nthe pitch of your voice.
With the Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo DSi, and\nNintendo DSi XL, you'll see another player's\nface. You can cover it with\ngraffiti using the button in the top-right\ncorner. You can also freeze the picture\nusing the button in the bottom-right corner.\n\n“SOUND ONLY" will be displayed\nif the DS system lacks a camera.
Tap one of the balloon icons on the\nbottom-right corner, and you can play a\nminigame with friend(s) on the Xtransceiver.\n\nDepending on the button you tap,\nyou can play different games.
Only the first person who used the\nXtransceiver can start a minigame.\n\nYou cannot play a minigame\nwith players who have Pokémon Black Version\nor Pokémon White Version.
The Unova region has eight Gyms. Each Gym\nhas its own Gym Leader, and you can win\nGym Badges by defeating those Gym Leaders.\n\n\nYou can tap the icon in the bottom-left\ncorner of the Trainer Card screen to check\nhow many Gym Badges you have.
As you collect Badges, the Pokémon you've\npicked up by trading will start to obey you\nwithout question, even if their level is high.
The Ready button is an easy shortcut\nto frequently used functions and items.\n\nOnce you register something with the\nReady button, just press the Y Button\nto use that item or function instantly.
You may see boxes on the Touch Screen when\nyou open the menu by pressing the X Button.\n\nTap the box or press the Y Button,\nand a check mark will appear in it.\n\nFunctions and items with check marks\nnext to them are the ones that\nare registered to the Ready button.
You will see boxes next to item names\nin the Key Items Case, as well.\n\nMove the cursor and press the Y Button,\nor tap to check them, and they will be\nregistered to work with the Ready button.
You can register up to 34 functions and items\nto the Ready button.\nTo unregister, tap a checked box or\npress the Y Button to remove the check mark.\nIf you have registered two or more functions\nand items, you can change the order of them\nby pressing SELECT.
The Medal Rally is an event that evaluates\nvarious activities of Trainers and rewards\nthem with Medals.\n\nYou can check Medals you've earned\nby choosing Medal Box in the Key Items Case\nin your Bag.
You can get Medals\nby speaking to Mr. Medal,\nwho shows up at Pokémon Centers\nif you meet certain conditions.
Insert one of the following games in another\nDS system, and turn the power ON.\n- Pokémon Diamond Version\n- Pokémon Pearl Version\n- Pokémon Platinum Version\n- Pokémon HeartGold Version\n- Pokémon SoulSilver Version\nThen tap DS Download Play in the DS Menu\nto select Poké Transfer.
When the Pokémon have been received,\nselect the six Pokémon you'd like\nto transfer to Pokémon Black Version 2 or\nPokémon White Version 2 and slide them\ninto the frame to your right.\n\nPokémon sent by Poké Transfer CANNOT\nbe returned to the games they came from.
Tap the Touch Screen to pull back\nthe Poké Ball, aim it at the Pokémon,\nand release the Poké Ball.\n\nSome Pokémon may be hiding in the grass\nor behind trees.
When hit by a Poké Ball, a Pokémon will\ncome out from where it's been hiding.\nThrow a second Poké Ball to catch it.\n\nTry to catch all six Pokémon\nwithin the time limit.
You may see pink mist from time to time.\nIf you hit it with your Poké Ball,\nthe Pokémon will fall asleep.\n\nPokémon cannot move while sleeping,\nso this makes it easier to catch them.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Text File : 75
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This Marine Tube is also known as a walk-\nthrough aquarium, meaning you can see\nPokémon living in the ocean as you walk.\c\nIn the morning, you can observe Mantine\nswimming elegantly. As the evening passes,\nyou'll see Frillish floating mysteriously.
The Marine Tube is an undersea tunnel,\nbuilt to commemorate the friendship\nbetween Undella Town and Humilau City.\c\nIt is made of hardened glass 9.8 inches\nthick, which can withstand high water\npressure and contact with huge Pokémon.\c\nThe Marine Tube was built using the best\ntechnology in Unova. Please walk through\nand contemplate the underwater scenery.

ABOUT MYSTERY GIFT
ABOUT THE CARD ALBUM
WHEN THE ALBUM IS FULL
BACK
INFO
Mystery Gift allows you\nto receive great gifts\r\nthrough various communication modes.\c\nOnce you have received a gift,\nplease go to any Pokémon Center and\r\npick it up from the deliveryman.\c
When you've received your Mystery Gift,\nyour Wonder Card will be displayed\r\nin the Card Album.\c\nYou can check the card to see\nif you've picked up the gift\r\nfrom a deliveryman.\c\nMake sure to pick up gifts\nthat are waiting for you.\c\nThere is a limit to how many\ncards you can save in the Album.\c\nYou can store up to 12 cards if you\nhave previously saved your game.\c\nIf you don't have a saved game yet,\nyou can store up to three cards.\c\nWhen the card slots are full, you will not\nbe able to receive any more. Please delete\r\nsome from the Album.\c
When the Card Album is full,\nyou cannot receive new cards.\c\nTo receive new cards,\nchoose a Wonder Card and\r\npress the A Button to throw it away.\c\nIf you have gifts waiting,\ngo to any Pokémon Center\c\nand pick up your gifts\nfrom the deliveryman.\c
When you've received a Mystery Gift,\nyour Wonder Card will be displayed\r\nin the Card Album.\c\nYou can check the card to see\nif you've picked up the gift\r\nfrom a deliveryman.\c\nMake sure to pick up gifts\nthat are waiting for you.\c\nThere is a limit to how many\ncards you can save in the Album.\c\nYou can store up to 12 cards if you have\npreviously saved your game.\c\nIf you don't have a saved game yet,\nyou can store up to three cards.\c\nWhen the card slots are full, you will not\nbe able to receive any more. Please delete\r\nsome from the Album.\c
Communicating. Please stand by...
Our deliveryman is currently overloaded\nwith gifts for you!\c\nPlease go see him at any Pokémon Center\nand pick up your gifts.\c
You've already received this gift.\nYou may not get another one.\c
There were no gifts to be found...\c
                    
You are out of room for Wonder Cards.\c\nYou may not accept another gift until you\nthrow away one or more Wonder Cards.

No

Park Crowds: Hey, what's going on?\nIs this one of those hero skits?
Brycen-Man: A single hit to KO\nmy Pokémon...\r\nYou're pretty good, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nDespite that, however...\c\nYou will get down on your knees before me\nwhen I end you with my dark, secret arts!\c\nPrepare to be finished!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Bring it on!
Brycen-Man: Well said!\c\nMy dark, secret arts enter!\nTake them and be gone!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: I'm scared!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nHow pitiful, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nWhy would I waste my secret arts\non someone like you?\c\nThis should do it!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\c\nThat's your Pokémon's best shot?\nHow disappointing!\c\nI'm done play battling with you,\nlittle girl!\c\nEnough! I must go now!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: This isn't how\nit's supposed to go...
Masked Man Brycen-Man walked\nright through the [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl...\c\nShe played such an insignificant role\nin this incident.\c\nNo wonder nobody wants to find out\nwho she is...\c\nHaving said that...\c\nThank you, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGood-bye, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nBraving my secret arts to take out\nmy Pokémon with one hit...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Don't you get it,\nBrycen-Man?!\c\nThis is an amusement park filled with the\nideals of people!\c\nBe on your best behavior and go home!
Brycen-Man: Very well.\nI shall pull back today.\c\nYou may be the Messenger of\nTruths and Ideals.\c\nBut I am Brycen-Man, the Masked Man of\nReality and Phantasm.\c\nMark my words, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl.
Park Crowds: Wow, she's\nso cute!\r\nI love the [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl:\nBrycen-Man, the Masked Man...\r\nWhat is he planning to do...?
Teaching Brycen-Man, the Masked Man,\na lesson, the [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl saved\r\nthe amusement park.\c\nHaving spoken in a daring tone,\nBrycen-Man disappeared into thin air...\c\nTo protect the truths and ideals of Unova,\ngo on, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nFight on, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nHow silly of you, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl.\c\nYou just missed the only chance\nyou had to defeat me!\c\nGo ahead and look around!
Park Crowds: Did you see that?\nLook at him go! He's so cool!\r\nBrycen-Man, the Masked Man!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nThe crowds are so mesmerized by me!\c\nPeople don't want a pitiful heroine like you.\nThey need a Masked Man like me!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: No way...
It was too much to witness people cheering\nfor Brycen-Man, the Masked Man\r\nof Reality and Phantasm.\c\nThe [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl lost all\nher strength to fight...\c\nCruel is the nature of battles...\c\nThe split-second decisions determined\nher fate as a heroine.\c\nToo bad, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGood-bye, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nFor me to lose to a pathetic little girl\nlike you...\c\nHow humiliating...\nI will settle this before too long...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: ...Br-Brycen-Man!\c\nEr... Heroines are always...strong\nand cute...\r\nWe never lose!\c\nSo, why don't you...just go now!
Teaching Brycen-Man, the Masked Man,\na lesson, the [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl saved\r\nthe amusement park.\c\nBut she has the weakness of being too timid!\c\nThis is a huge problem in a heroine!\c\nTo protect the truths and ideals of Unova,\nfight on, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nDon't wimp out, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nThis is the end for you, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nI didn't even have to use\nmy secret arts!\c\nNow, just stand in the corner,\nand watch me destroy the amusement park!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Wah...\nI wasn't heroine material after all...
Facing Brycen-Man, the Masked Man,\nthe [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl\r\nlost all her strength to fight...\c\nHowever...\c\nNo one will ever forget how she overcame\nher fear and fought with all her might!\c\nThank you, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGood-bye, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Oh no!\nThe attack missed...
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nYou can't even use a move right?\nAre you really supposed to be a heroine?\c\nYou just lowered my dark can-do spirit\nby a lot!\c\nI can't be doing this! Enough is enough!\nI'll return to my hideout!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Er...\nWait! Wait a second!
Facing Brycen-Man, the Masked Man,\nthe [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl couldn't even\r\nattack correctly.\c\nAs a heroine, she made crucial and\nembarrassing mistakes...\r\nIt was too much to witness her failure.\r\nBrycen-Man lost all his will to fight...\c\nToo bad, Brycen-Man!\c\nFight on, Brycen-Man!

Crew: Passengers, we are departing soon.\nPlease proceed on board.

Crew: Passengers, we are departing now.

The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Out of MY way!
Brycen-Man: Such a big mouth!\c\nVery well, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\nLet me punish you for making me mad!\c\nI'll sink you and your Pokémon to the\nbottom of the sea!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Why would I?
Brycen-Man: Arg! Shut your mouth!\nI have nothing to chat with you about!\c\nGet out of my way already!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Bathroom?
Brycen-Man: Stop messing with me!\c\nBrycen-Man, the Masked Man,\nnever goes to the bathroom!
Crew: Attention, please.\c\nThe ship is ready for departure.\c\nPassengers, please proceed to the\nnearest counter.
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nI'm running out of time... The ship...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: What's wrong?\c\nYou've been acting funny!\nYou must be planning to do something bad!
Brycen-Man: Silence!\c\nI have no words for you!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: You want what?
Brycen-Man: Don't make me repeat it!\nI have nothing to tell you, OK!\c\nJust get out of my sight!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Bathroom, right?
Brycen-Man: You are persistent!\nI don't need to go to the bathroom\r\nat this moment!\c\nYou underestimate what a Masked Man can do!\nLet me crush you!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: So suspicious!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nI am a Masked Man!\r\nBeing suspicious is part of wearing a mask!\c\nHow could a little girl like you even begin\nto understand my great ambition?!
Whistles: Toot toot toot!
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nThe ship...\nThe ship has departed...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Brycen-Man!\nYou are so predictable!\r\nThe cruise ship is gone!\c\nShe departed safely with the\nblack diamond you were after!
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\c\nI cannot give up yet... Desperate times call\nfor desperate measures!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Brycen-Man!
Splash!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Really?\nThose were your desperate measures?\c\nI can't keep up with you...
Brycen-Man: To fulfill my great ambition,\nthe black diamond is absolutely necessary!\c\nI must obtain it no matter how many\nsacrifices I have to make.\r\nDon't underestimate masked men!\c\nFarewell, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man, the Masked Man,\ndisappeared into the ocean\r\nto go after the luxury liner.\c\nWhat is the nature of his terrible ambition?\nWhat makes him go after the black diamond\r\nso persistently?\c\nWhatever his plan is,\nwe can count on the [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGo on, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGood luck, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: This can't be...\c\nWith my Pokémon defeated,\nI cannot steal that hidden treasure,\r\nthe black diamond, on the cruise ship...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: ...What did you say?\nA hidden treasure? A black diamond?
Brycen-Man: You don't know anything...\c\nThe black diamond is a mysterious hidden\ntreasure that multiplies the power of\r\nits owner.
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: A jewel with\nsuch a great power...
Brycen-Man: That's right!\c\nWith the black diamond,\na little girl like you won't be...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Giggle giggle...
Brycen-Man: What's so funny...?
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Giggle!\c\nAre you telling me with this black diamond,\nI'll be an even cuter heroine?
Brycen-Man: Arrgh...\nYou are not thinking about...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Giggle.\c\nSomething just came up.\nSee you!
Brycen-Man: Wow, wow... Wait!\nAren't you the heroine here?
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl defeated\nBrycen-Man, the Masked Man!\c\nHearing from him the power of the black\ndiamond, she is now after the cruise ship!\c\nCome on, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nWake up, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!
Brycen-Man: Mwahaha!\nI am always quite busy.\c\nSo being quick is my second nature.\nThat's how a great Masked Man should be!
[VAR 0102(0000)] Girl: Aiyee!\nThis can't be happening...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl was\ndefeated by Brycen-Man, the Masked Man...\c\nAnd what's worse...\c\nBrycen-Man managed to steal the black\ndiamond that was on board the luxury liner,\r\nsold it for a fortune to retire,\r\nand lived happily ever after.\c\nLong story short...\c\nToo bad, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!\c\nGood-bye, [VAR 0102(0000)] Girl!

Then, a few years later...\c\nThe [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja abused the\ndynamatronic engine and made a fortune.\c\nHe became a big shot and is now untouchable,\neven by the World Police...\c\nYou must be frustrated, Mecha Cop!\nThe power of money is frightening!

Mecha Cop: Whoa! Stop!\nDestroyer Security System!\r\nI'm a member of the World Police...

Mecha Cop: Halt! Stehen geblieben!\n[VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja!\c\nOh! This is...a bomb?!

Mecha Cop: I...\nWas I abandoned by justice?\c\nI don't know what to believe anymore!

The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: (...A guy like that\nis a champion of justice...)\r\n(...How appalling...)

The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Let me go!

Mecha Cop: Bring it!\nThis battle is for keeps!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Heh!\nIt's been a long time since\r\nI've had so much fun battling!
Mecha Cop: I labeled every criminal a villain.\nOnce someone has a label slapped on them,\r\nthat label becomes a signpost of how to\r\ntreat them. Thinking about it...\c\nOnce I labeled you a villain, I no longer\ntreated you like a fellow human being.\c\nBut criminals are still human beings.\nTheir crimes may be unforgivable, but\r\ntheir human dignity must still be respected,\r\nor there would be no way to tell the\r\ndifference between justice and injustice.
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: ...\nMecha Cop...?
Mecha Cop: Justice...\nReal justice, that I can believe in...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Mecha Cop...\nBy any chance, are you taking it easy on me?
Mecha Cop: Time will be the judge of that...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Get hold of yourself!\nYou represent the World Police,\r\nand I'm a thief, a criminal, a villain!\r\nWe...are...enemies!
Mecha Cop: [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja.\nOur battles have made me question\r\nthe definition of justice...\c\nAs a secret detective, I'm a failure.\nThe last thing that I can do for you is...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Get a grip, crybaby!\nMy archenemy, Mecha Cop,\r\nwouldn't show himself to be a pushover!
Mecha Cop: Protecting justice...\c\n...A concept I no longer believe in.\nNothing really matters anymore...
Mecha Cop: I was trapped in a mechanical\nframework of justice.\r\nYou've woken me up.\r\n[VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Gulp...\nWhat are you trying to say?
Mecha Cop: But you are a thief.\nI cannot forgive your crimes...\c\nBut...if you pay for your crimes,\nthen, together, we...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Say no more!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Wait...\nWhat do you mean--nothing matters anymore?
Mecha Cop: Justice, evil...\nA robot can't tell the difference.\c\nPush my buttons, and I recite the\ncode of the World Police.
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: You...\nYou've changed...
Mecha Cop: Changed?\nWhat do you mean?\c\nAll I've ever been is a cog in the wheel,\na mouthpiece for the World Police...\c\nAn antiseptic,\nunemotional\r\nrobot.
Riot Police: Calling all members!\nApprehend the [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja immediately!
Mecha Cop: Wait.\nShe won't run away anymore...\r\nRight? The...[VAR 0102(0000)]...Ninja...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Tee hee hee.\nI lost, Mecha Cop...
Mecha Cop: Mission accomplie.\c\nNow, [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja,\nit's time for you to pay for your crimes.\r\nReady to turn over a new leaf...?
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: ...\c\n...\nThanks...
Thus, the [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja, who escaped\nprison so many times before, went to prison\r\nat the hands of Mecha Cop.\c\nAnd the [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja never again\nattempted escape...so they say...
Then, several years later...\c\nThe secret detective, Mecha Cop,\nwho protects citizens from crime,\c\nhas a new partner at his side.\nA partner by the name of...The [VAR 0102(0000)]!\c\nListen to your human side, Mecha Cop!\nCondemn the crime, not the criminal.
Mecha Cop: I lost. I failed.\nSchluss, aus, finito!\r\nGo! Run! Get away!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Mecha Cop!\nI'm disappointed in you.
Mecha Cop: After all, I'm just...\n...a cyborg.\r\nI lost my heart a long time ago.\c\nWhat...?\n...\r\nTears, idle tears...\r\nI know not what they mean...

The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Sweet freedom!\nAs for the World Police--so predictable!\c\nNo matter how many secret detectives\nyou send after me,\r\nyou can't catch me!
Riot Police: There she is! Stop her!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Farewell,\nladies and gentlemen of the World Police!
Riot Police: Wha... Amazing!\nShe flew! How did she do that?
Mecha Cop: [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja!\nWait! ...Wait!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja, who escaped\nfrom prison so many times before...\r\nescaped from Mecha Cop's grasp once more.
Fifty years pass...\c\nThe spry [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja\nis still running, and Mecha Cop, nearly ready\r\nfor the scrap heap, is still chasing her,\r\nand running...and escaping...\r\nand chasing...and...\c\nTake a break already, Mecha Cop!\nSomebody, make them stop!
Riot Police: Woot!\nWe'll catch the [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja!
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: I think not...\nI'll never be captured by the likes of you...
Mecha Cop: Stop!\nEven when facing a villain,\c\nit's not fair to interrupt a\none-on-one Pokémon battle!\r\nFor shame!
Riot Police: We're sorry,\nMecha Cop...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Heh! No kidding!\nEverybody wants a free pass to get\r\naway with unfair things like that.\c\nAfter all, what you call justice is...
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Obsolete.
Mecha Cop: That's not true!\c\nWhenever, wherever, and whoever\nmakes the effort to do the right thing--\r\nhe or she can be a champion of justice!\c\n[VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja!\nKnow what? You're no exception yourself.
The [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja: Old fashioned.
Mecha Cop: Wh-what?\nA simple trench coat over a metal body--\r\nI'm as fashion forward as I can get.\c\nYou're the one in need of a\ncostume intervention, [VAR 0102(0000)] Ninja!

E: So what?
[VAR 0100(0001)]: So...this.\c\nWe don't object to having you aliens, new to\nthis planet, join us and live here together.\c\nBut we do object to your going elsewhere\nand eliminating other life-forms and\r\ntaking over their planet for yourselves.

[VAR 0100(0001)]: Seriously?

The battle for humanity's future was over.\c\nAll UFOs and aliens returned to the\nmothership and left the planet.\c\nRejoicing, everyone cheered and held hands.\c\nBut one person among them all, [VAR 0100(0001)],\nstood gazing up at the starry sky...

Fly to where?

Pokémon are like our puppets!\c\nThey are bound by their Poké Balls and\ncontrolled by our orders!
This is our place! We aren't going to\nlet anyone mess with it!\c
Ahhhh! The floor is covered in mud after all\nthat fighting!
There are people who can't live anywhere\nbut here! You got a problem with that?!
Come! Satisfy my urge to battle!
Marvelous! I shall believe in my Pokémon!
If-if I'd believed more, could I have drawn\nout my Pokémon's power?
The bonds between us... Does the fact that\nwe can't see them make them more real?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Hi there!\c
How are things going with the Pokédex?\c\nSorry, I can't help but ask.\nBe sure to enjoy your journey, though!\c
You get more detailed information\nin the Pokédex by catching Pokémon!\c
Filling up pages in the Pokédex\nis very important, but don't forget...\c\nInteracting with Pokémon is a hundred--\neven a thousand--times more important!\c
I'm working with Pokémon Professors\nfrom other regions and trying to solve\r\nthe mysteries of Pokémon.\c\nEven with their help,\nwe can't find every answer.\c\nBut, if we learn things little by little,\nit may leave clues for the researchers\r\nwho follow us.\c
What can I do to improve the\nPokédex that will make everyone happy?\c
Looking at you reminds me of when\nI was a Backpacker, and it really\r\nmotivates me!\c\nThat's right! I also traveled the\nUnova region with a Pokédex!\c
I met your mother\nwhen I was a Backpacker!\c\nWe got to talking at the\ncounter in the Pokémon Center,\r\nand a huge line formed behind me!\c
I'm sure there are still Pokémon\nthat no one in the world has seen!\c\nDoesn't just imagining them make\nyou excited?\c
Dream big!\c\nI want to see every\nPokémon in the world!\c
In order to get along with others,\nyou must be understanding and accepting.\c\nI mean, Pokémon and people live\nby different rules!\c\nIf we just push our expectations on them,\nthere's no way it will go well.\c
OK, then! Take care.\nBye-bye!\c
Yeah?\c
You have to protect what's important\nto you on your own!\c
People who are strong in Pokémon\nbattles aren't automatically right.\c\nBut losers don't even have a leg\nto stand on, know what I mean?\c
When it's night\nand everything's quiet...\c\nIf you listen carefully,\nyou can hear the footsteps of Pokémon.\c\nI really like that.\c
If you believe in yourself\nand have Pokémon by your side,\r\neven being lost is fun!\c
I'm thinking about what Pokémon\nI should have to make up for\r\nmy other Pokémon's weaknesses.\c
I don't care what the reason is.\nIf you take other people's stuff,\r\nyou're nothing more than a dirty thief!\c
I like spending time thinking\nabout how to raise my Pokémon\r\nand make them stronger.\c
I guess if I had to pick a trait I prefer,\nI like Pokémon that are fast...\c
Hey, sorry!\nThere's something I want to do right now!\c
Um...\nI don't have much to say right now.\c
See ya!\c
Where am I now?\c\nI'm searching every corner of\nCastelia City for Team Plasma!\c\nYou haven't found them either, right?\nWe HAVE to find them!\c\nGot it?!\c

Text File : 396
