Stench, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can\nsometimes make the target flinch.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt lowers the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when the leading\r\nparty member has it.\c
Drizzle, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability make it rain\nwhen they enter the battle.\c
Speed Boost, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises a Pokémon's\nSpeed every turn.\c
Battle Armor, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability cannot be\nhit critically.\c\nSome attacks are supposed to score a\ncritical hit every time, but that won't\r\nhappen against Pokémon with this Ability.\c
Sturdy, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst one-hit KO moves.\c\nIt also leaves the Pokémon with a tiny bit\nof HP if hit by a move that would knock\r\nit out when its HP is full.\c
Damp, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is\nin battle, no Pokémon can use\r\nSelfdestruct or Explosion.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nThe Aftermath Ability won't trigger.\nYou should remember that, too.\c
Limber, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst the paralysis status condition.\c
Sand Veil, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles a Pokémon's\nevasiveness in sandstorms.\c\nAlso, sandstorms don't damage the\nPokémon, regardless of its type.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt lowers the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when it leads your party\r\nin a sandstorm.\c
Static, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can inflict\nthe paralysis status condition\r\nwhen hit with a direct attack.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nElectric-type wild Pokémon when\r\nthe leading party member has it.\c
Volt Absorb, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability do not\ntake damage from Electric-type moves.\r\nTheir HP is restored a little instead.\c
Water Absorb, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability do not\ntake damage from Water-type moves\r\nTheir HP is restored a little instead.\c
Oblivious, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst the infatuated status condition.\c
Cloud Nine, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is\nin battle, it eliminates effects of weather\r\non Pokémon.\c\nThe weather condition still\nexists, however.\c
Compoundeyes, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises a Pokémon's accuracy.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon with held items when\r\nthe leading party member has it.\c
Insomnia, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability is immune to the\nsleep status condition, even when its own\r\nmove would make it fall asleep.\c
Color Change, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability changes\nits type to match the type of the move\r\nthat just hit it.\c
Immunity, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst the poison status condition.\c
Flash Fire, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability do not\ntake damage from Fire-type moves.\c\nInstead, the power of their own\nFire-type moves is increased.\c
Shield Dust, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nfrom additional effects of moves.\c
Own Tempo, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst the confused status condition.\c
Suction Cups, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability nullifies moves\nlike Whirlwind and Roar, which would\r\nforce Pokémon to switch out.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is leading\nyour party, it makes Pokémon bite more\r\noften when fishing.\c
Intimidate, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability lowers\nthe opposing Pokémon's Attack\r\nwhen it enters battle.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is leading\nyour party, it lowers the chance\r\nto encounter low-level wild Pokémon.\c
Shadow Tag, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability prevents the\nopposing Pokémon from fleeing.\c\nThey can't even switch out normally.\c\nHowever, if a move's added effect would\nmake them switch out, that still works.\r\nThis is something you should remember.\c
Rough Skin, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability reduces the HP\nof an opposing Pokémon that hits it\r\nwith a direct attack.\c
Wonder Guard, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are\nprotected against damage from\r\nall moves that aren't super effective.\c\nIt's a very powerful Ability...\c\nBut the Pokémon still takes damage\nfrom weather and status conditions.\c
Levitate, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are immune\nto all Ground-type moves.\c\nOh, I almost forgot about it!\c\nThere is an exception to that.\nSand-Attack still hits the target.\c
Effect Spore, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can inflict the\npoison, paralysis, or sleep status\r\ncondition when hit with a direct attack.\c
Synchronize, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is\npoisoned, burned, or has paralysis,\r\nthe same status condition is passed on to\r\nthe Pokémon that caused that condition.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon with the same Nature\r\nwhen the leading party member has it.\c
Clear Body, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst stat-lowering moves and Abilities.\c\nBut!\c\nThe burned status condition still halves\ntheir Attack, and the paralysis status\r\ncondition still lowers their Speed to a\r\nquarter of what it was.\c
Natural Cure, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability cure their\nstatus conditions when they switch out.\c\nTheir status conditions are also cured\nwhen a battle ends.\r\nThat's another thing you should remember.\c
Lightningrod, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are immune\nto all Electric-type moves.\c\nThat's not all!\c\nIts Sp. Atk goes up every time it\ntakes an Electric-type move.\c\nThere's more!\c\nThis Ability draws Electric-type moves\nto the Pokémon.\c\nIt doesn't do any good in a Single Battle,\nbut it should be useful in Double Battles\r\nand Triple Battles.\c
Serene Grace, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are more likely\nto inflict added effects.\c
Swift Swim, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles a Pokémon's\nSpeed when it's raining.\c
Chlorophyll, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability double their\nSpeed in sunny weather.\c
Illuminate, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is leading\nyour party, you're more likely\r\nto encounter wild Pokémon.\c\nBy the way, its effect in battle\nisn't understood as of yet...\c
Trace, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability enters\nbattle, its Ability changes to match the\r\nopposing Pokémon's Ability.\c\nIn a battle, being able to tell the\nopponent's Ability can be very useful.\r\nYou should remember that.\c
Huge Power, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles a Pokémon's\nAttack stat.\c
Poison Point, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can inflict\nthe poison status condition\r\nwhen hit with a direct attack.\c
Inner Focus, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability don't flinch.\c
Magma Armor, huh...\c\nThis Ability prevents the frozen\nstatus condition.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt makes Eggs in your party hatch faster.\c
Water Veil, huh...\c\nThis Ability prevents the burned\nstatus condition.\c
Magnet Pull, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability prevents\nopposing Steel-type Pokémon from fleeing.\c\nThey can't even switch out.\c\nHowever, if a move's added effect would\nmake them switch out, that still works.\r\nThis is something you should remember.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nSteel-type wild Pokémon\r\nwhen the leading party member has it.\c
Soundproof, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nfrom sound-based moves.\c\nThey are protected from their allies'\nmoves, too, even helpful ones.\r\nSo be careful in Double Battles\r\nand Triple Battles.\c
Rain Dish, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability restore HP\nby a little every turn when it's raining.\c
Sand Stream, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability causes a\nsandstorm when it enters the battle.\c
Pressure, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is hit by\nan opposing Pokémon's move, the PP\r\n(Power Points) of that move are depleted.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nhigh-level wild Pokémon\r\nwhen the leading party member has it.\c
Thick Fat, huh...\c\nThis Ability halves damage from\nFire- and Ice-type moves.\c
Early Bird, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability\nwakes quickly from the sleep condition.\c
Flame Body, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability can inflict\nthe burned status condition\r\nwhen hit with a direct attack.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt makes Eggs in your party\nhatch faster.\c
Run Away, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can always\nescape from a battle with a wild Pokémon.\c\nIt can even ignore the effects of moves\nand Abilities that normally prevent\r\nPokémon from running away.\c
Keen Eye, huh...\c\nThis Ability prevents\naccuracy from being lowered.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt lowers the chance to encounter\nlow-level wild Pokémon\r\nwhen the leading party member has it.\c
Hyper Cutter, huh...\c\nThis Ability prevents\nAttack from being lowered.\c
Pickup, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability may\npick up the item the opposing Pokémon\r\nused that turn at the end of the turn.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt sometimes picks up an item\nafter battle even if it didn't participate.\c\nJust so you know...\c\nThe higher the Pokémon's level is,\nthe better item it picks up.\c\nOne more thing...\c\nIf the Pokémon is holding an item already,\nthis Ability does nothing.\c
Truant, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can\nuse a move only once every other turn.\c\nOne strike to end the battle, so to speak!\c\nThat's how you win a battle with\nthis Ability.\c
Hustle, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's\nAttack but lowers its accuracy.\c\nThis has no effect on moves that\nare sure hits.\r\nYou should remember that.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nhigh-level wild Pokémon\r\nwhen the leading party member has it.\c
Cute Charm, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can inflict\nthe infatuated status condition\r\nwhen hit with a direct attack.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon of the opposite gender.\c
Plus, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's\nSp. Atk when another ally has the Ability\r\nPlus or Minus.\c\nThis does nothing in a Single Battle,\nbut it can raise each other's Sp. Atk\r\nin Double Battles and Triple Battles.\c\nActually, it could prove to be very useful\nin Double Battles and Triple Battles.\c
Minus, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's\nSp. Atk when another ally has the Ability\r\nMinus or Plus.\c\nThis does nothing in a Single Battle,\nbut it can raise each other's Sp. Atk\r\nin Double Battles and Triple Battles.\c\nActually, it could prove to be very useful\nin Double Battles and Triple Battles.\c
Forecast, huh...\c\nThis Ability changes Castform's type.\c\nIts type changes to Fire in\nsunny weather,\r\nWater in the rain,\r\nand Ice in a hailstorm.\c
Sticky Hold, huh...\c\nThis Ability prevents the Pokémon's held\nitem from being stolen.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt makes Pokémon bite more often\nwhile fishing when the leading party\r\nmember has it.\c
Shed Skin, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can cure their\nstatus conditions during a battle.\c
Guts, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's Attack\nwhen it's affected by a status condition.\c\nThat's not all!\c\nThis effect prevents Attack from being\nhalved by the burned status condition.\c\nBe careful, though...\nIt'll still take damage every turn\r\nwhen it's burned.\c
Marvel Scale, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's Defense\nwhen it's affected by a status condition.\c\nBe careful that this effect does not get\ntriggered by conditions such as the\r\nconfused or infatuated status conditions.\c
Liquid Ooze, huh...\c\nWhen an opposing Pokémon\nuses an HP-draining move,\r\nthis Ability damages the user\r\nby half the damage taken instead.\c
Overgrow, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the power of\nGrass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP\r\nbecomes low.\c\nDon't give up even when the Pokémon\nis in a pinch!\c
Blaze, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the power of\nFire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP\r\nbecomes low.\c\nDon't give up even when the Pokémon\nis in a pinch!\c
Torrent, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the power of\nWater-type moves when the Pokémon's HP\r\nbecomes low.\c\nDon't give up even when the Pokémon\nis in a pinch!\c
Swarm, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the power of\nBug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP\r\nbecomes low.\c\nDon't give up even when the Pokémon\nis in a pinch!\c
Rock Head, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are immune\nto recoil damage from moves.\c
Drought, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability makes\nthe weather sunny\r\nwhen it enters the battle.\c
Arena Trap, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability prevent the\nopposing Pokémon from fleeing unless\r\nthey are Flying type or Pokémon\r\nwith the Levitate Ability.\c\nThey can't even switch out.\c\nAlthough, they can still switch out\nby a move's added effect.\r\nThis is something you should remember.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when the leading party\r\nmember has it.\c
Vital Spirit, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst the sleep status condition.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nhigh-level wild Pokémon when the leading\r\nparty member has it.\c
White Smoke, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability are protected\nagainst stat-lowering moves and Abilities.\c\nBut!\c\nThe burned status condition still halves\ntheir Attack, and the paralysis status\r\ncondition still lowers their Speed\r\nto a quarter of what it was.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt lowers the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when the leading party\r\nmember has it.\c
Pure Power, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles the Pokémon's Attack.\c
Shell Armor, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability cannot be\nhit critically.\c\nSome attacks are supposed to score a\ncritical hit every time, but that won't\r\nhappen against Pokémon with this Ability.\c
Air Lock, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is\nin battle, it eliminates effects of weather\r\non Pokémon.\c\nThe weather condition still\nexists, however.\c
Tangled Feet, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's\nevasiveness when it's confused.\c
Motor Drive, huh...\c\nThis Ability not only nullifies the damage\nbut also raises the Pokémon's Speed\r\nwhen it's hit by an Electric-type move.\c
Rivalry, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the power of\nthe Pokémon's move when the target is\r\nof the same gender.\c\nHowever, if the target is the opposite\ngender, the move's power goes down.\c
Steadfast, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's Speed\nevery time it flinches.\c
Snow Cloak, huh...\c\nThe evasiveness of the Pokémon with this\nAbility goes up when it's hailing.\r\nWhat's more...\c\nIf a Pokémon with this Ability is leading\nthe party in a hailstorm, it lowers the\r\nchance to encounter wild Pokémon.\c
Gluttony, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability uses its held\nBerry when its HP is half or less.\c
Anger Point, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises the Pokémon's Attack\nto the maximum when hit by a critical hit.\c
Unburden, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles the Pokémon's Speed\nif it loses or consumes a held item.\c\nIt won't do a thing if the Pokémon has\nno held item to begin with, though.\c
Heatproof, huh...\c\nThis Ability halves damage\nfrom Fire-type moves.\c\nYou should remember that\nit also halves damage from burns.\c
Simple, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles the effect of\nstat changes.\c\nYou should remember that\nboth stat-raising and stat-lowering\r\neffects get doubled.\c
Dry Skin, huh...\c\nThis Ability restores HP when\nthe Pokémon is hit by a Water-type move\r\nor when it's raining...\c\nHowever, the Pokémon receives increased\ndamage from Fire-type moves and takes\r\ndamage from sunny weather.\c
Download, huh...\c\nWhen the Pokémon enters battle,\nthis Ability raises its Attack\r\nif the opposing Pokémon's Defense is lower\r\nthan its Sp. Def.\c\nIt raises Sp. Atk if the opposing\nPokémon's Sp. Def is lower\r\nthan its Defense.\c
Iron Fist, huh...\c\nThis Ability increases the power of\nmoves that punch the target.\c
Poison Heal, huh...\c\nThis Ability restores HP every turn\nif the Pokémon is inflicted with the\r\npoison status condition.\c
Adaptability, huh...\c\nWhen the Pokémon uses a move that\nmatches its type, this Ability increases\r\nthe power boost.\c
Skill Link, huh...\c\nWith this Ability, moves with multiple hits\nwill always strike the maximum number\r\nof times.\c
Hydration, huh...\c\nThis Ability cures status conditions\nat the end of the turn if it's raining.\c
Solar Power, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises Sp. Atk\nin sunny weather, but the Pokémon\r\nalso takes damage every turn,\r\nso be careful.\c
Quick Feet, huh...\c\nThis Ability raises Speed when the Pokémon\nis affected by status conditions.\c\nIt nullifies the Speed-lowering\neffect of paralysis as well.\c\nWhat's more...\c\nIt lowers the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when the leading party\r\nmember has it.\c
Normalize, huh...\c\nThis Ability turns all of the Pokémon's\nmoves to Normal-type moves.\c
Sniper, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability deal a great\namount of damage when delivering\r\na critical hit.\c
Magic Guard, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability do not take\ndamage from anything other than attacks.\c
No Guard, huh...\c\nMoves used by or against the Pokémon with\nthis Ability always strike their targets.\r\nWhat's more...\c\nIt raises the chance to encounter\nwild Pokémon when the leading party\r\nmember has it.\c
Stall, huh...\c\nMoves by the Pokémon with this Ability\nare used last in the turn\r\nregardless of its Speed.\c
Technician, huh...\c\nThis Ability increases the power of\nweaker moves.\c
Leaf Guard, huh...\c\nThis Ability protects the Pokémon from\nstatus conditions in sunny weather.\c
Klutz, huh...\c\nItems have no effect when held\nby the Pokémon with this Ability.\c
Mold Breaker, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability uses moves on\ntargets regardless of their Abilities.\c
Super Luck, huh...\c\nThis Ability heightens the critical-hit\nratio of the Pokémon's moves.\c
Aftermath, huh...\c\nThis Ability deals damage to the attacking\nPokémon when a direct attack causes the\r\nPokémon to faint.\c
Anticipation, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability will shudder\nif the opposing Pokémon knows a\r\nsupereffective move.\c\nYou should remember that it also warns\nwhen the opposing Pokémon knows\r\na one-hit KO move,\r\nSelfdestruct, or Explosion.\c
Forewarn, huh...\c\nThis Ability reveals a move an opposing\nPokémon knows when the Pokémon\r\nenters battle.\c\nBy the way,\nyou should remember that damaging moves\r\nwith high power are prioritized.\c
Unaware, huh...\c\nThis Ability ignores the stat changes of\nthe opposing Pokémon.\c\nBut!\c\nIt does not ignore changes to the Speed\nstat, so be careful.\c
Tinted Lens, huh...\c\nThis Ability doubles the damage of the\nPokémon's not-very-effective moves.\c
Filter, huh...\c\nThis Ability reduces damage from\nsupereffective moves.\c
Slow Start, huh...\c\nThis Ability halves Attack and Speed\nfor five turns when the Pokémon\r\nenters battle.\c\nTo win battles with this Ability, the key is\nto endure the first five turns!\c
Scrappy, huh...\c\nThis Ability lets the Pokémon hit\nGhost-type Pokémon with Normal- and\r\nFighting-type moves.\c
Storm Drain, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability do not\ntake damage from Water-type moves.\c\nThat's not all!\c\nIts Sp. Atk goes up every time it\ntakes a Water-type move.\c\nThere's more!\c\nThis Ability draws Water-type moves\nto the Pokémon.\c\nIt doesn't do any good in Single Battles,\nbut it should be useful in Double Battles\r\nand Triple Battles.\c
Ice Body, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nrecover a little bit of HP every turn\r\nduring a hailstorm.\c
Solid Rock, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\ntake less damage from\r\nsupereffective moves.\c
Snow Warning, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability changes the\nweather to hail when it enters a battle.\c
Honey Gather, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability\nwill sometimes be left holding\r\nHoney after a battle.\c\nIts chance of finding Honey\nincreases with its level,\r\nso you should keep that in mind.\c
Frisk, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability\nwill tell you what item\r\nan opponent is holding.\c
Reckless, huh...\c\nIf a Pokémon with this Ability\nuses a move that has recoil,\r\nthe power of that move will increase.\c\nDon't forget that this Ability's effect\nalso works on moves that damage\r\nthe user when the move misses!\c
Multitype, huh...\c\nArceus has this Ability.\nWhen it holds an item called a Plate,\r\nits type shifts according to the Plate!\c
Flower Gift, huh...\c\nWhen a Cherrim with this Ability\nis in sunny weather, its form changes,\r\nand its Attack and Sp. Def stats go up!\c\nIn Double and Triple Battles, it also\nmakes its allies' stats increase!\c
Bad Dreams, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability reduce the HP\nof sleeping Pokémon every turn!\c
Pickpocket, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit with a direct attack,\r\nit can steal the attacker's held item.\c\nWell...\c\nIt only works if the attacker is holding\nan item, though.\c
Sheer Force, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nuses a move with an additional effect,\r\nthe power goes up,\r\nbut the additional effect won't work.\c
Contrary, huh...\c\nStat changes have the opposite effect\non Pokémon with this Ability!\c\nWhen stats should go up, they go down,\nand when they should go down, they go up!\c
Unnerve, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis in battle, the opposing Pokémon\r\nwon't be able to eat Berries.\c
Defiant, huh...\c\nWhen an opponent lowers the stats\nof a Pokémon with this Ability,\r\nits Attack goes way up!\c\nBut be careful--if it lowers\nits own stats, the Ability won't work!\c
Defeatist, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon has this Ability\nand its HP is reduced to half or less,\r\nits Attack and Sp. Atk go down.\c\nYou absolutely can't afford\nto let these Pokémon's HP go down.\c\nI guess that's one good thing\nabout this Ability...\c
Cursed Body, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by an attack, sometimes\r\nit will Disable that attack.\c
Healer, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability sometimes\nheal the status conditions\r\nof allies that are battling with it.\c\nThey can't heal themselves,\nso it doesn't mean much in Single Battles,\r\nbut it's a very useful Ability\r\nto have in Double and Triple Battles.\c
Friend Guard, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nreduce damage done to\r\nother Pokémon battling with it.\c\nIt doesn't reduce damage to itself,\nso it doesn't mean much in Single Battles,\r\nbut it's a very useful Ability\r\nto have in Double and Triple Battles.\c
Weak Armor, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by a physical attack,\r\nDefense goes down,\r\nbut Speed goes up!\c
Heavy Metal, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nare twice as heavy.\c
Light Metal, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nare half as heavy.\c
Multiscale, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability has\nfull HP, the damage it takes is reduced.\c\nRemember, as long as the Pokémon's\nHP is full, the Ability will keep working.\c
Toxic Boost, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this\nAbility is poisoned,\r\nit's Attack goes up.\c
Flare Boost, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with\nthis Ability is burned,\r\nits Sp. Atk goes up.\c
Harvest, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability sometimes\nrestore the Berry they used.\c\nRemember that if the weather\nis sunny, the Berry will always\r\nbe restored.\c
Telepathy, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\ncan read their allies' minds\r\nand avoid collateral damage.\c\nIt's not useful in Single Battles,\nbut it's a very important Ability\r\nfor Double and Triple Battles.\c
Moody, huh...\c\nAt the end of a turn,\nPokémon with this Ability\r\nraise one stat sharply\r\nand lower another.\c
Overcoat, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\naren't damaged by the weather.\c
Poison Touch, huh...\c\nWhen Pokémon with this Ability\nland a direct attack,\r\nthe target is sometimes poisoned.\c
Regenerator, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis withdrawn from battle,\r\nit restores a little of its HP.\c
Big Pecks, huh...\c\nThe Defense of Pokémon with this Ability\ncan't be lowered by an opponent.\c
Sand Rush, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis in a sandstorm,\r\nits Speed doubles.\c\nAlso, it won't be damaged by a\nsandstorm, regardless of its type.\c
Wonder Skin, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nare more likely to dodge status moves.\c\nDon't forget, though: if the Pokémon uses\na status move on itself, this Ability\r\nwon't work.\c
Analytic, huh...\c\nWhen Pokémon with this Ability\nattack last, the power\r\nof the move goes up.\c
Illusion, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability\nwill appear in battle disguised\r\nas the last Pokémon in your party.\c\nBe careful. If it's hit by an attack,\nthe disguise will go away.\c
Imposter, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\ncomes into battle,\r\nit will Transform into its opponent.\c\nAnd it's not just looks...\nIt knows its opponent's moves,\r\nand some of its stats are the same, too!\c
Infiltrator, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can\nget past effects protecting the target\r\nand hit it with a move.\c
Mummy, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by a direct attack,\r\nthe Ability of the attacker\r\nwill change to Mummy.\c
Moxie, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nknocks out an opponent,\r\nits Attack goes up.\c
Justified, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by a Dark-type move,\r\nits Attack goes up.\c
Rattled, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability is hit\nby a Ghost-, Bug-, or Dark-type move,\r\nits Speed goes up.\c
Magic Bounce, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability\nreflect status moves used on them\r\nright back at the user!\c\nAnd get this!\c\nThe status move does not affect\nthe target!\c
Sap Sipper, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by a Grass-type move,\r\nits Attack goes up.\c\nIt also takes no damage or\nadded effects from those moves.\c
Prankster, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can\nuse status moves earlier\r\nthan usual.\c
Sand Force, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis in a sandstorm, the power of\r\nits Ground-, Rock-, and Steel-type moves\r\ngoes up!\c
Iron Barbs, huh...\c\nWhen a Pokémon with this Ability\nis hit by a direct attack,\r\nthe attacker takes damage as well.\c
Zen Mode, huh...\c\nA Darmanitan with this Ability\nenters Zen Mode when its HP\r\nis reduced to half or less.\c\nWhen in Zen Mode, it's a Psychic-\nand Fire-type Pokémon.\c\nIts Attack and Speed go down, but its\nDefense, Sp. Atk, and Sp. Def increase!\c
Victory Star, huh...\c\nA Pokémon with this Ability\nraises the accuracy\r\nof itself and its allies.\c
Turboblaze, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can use\nmoves on targets regardless\r\nof their Abilities.\c
Teravolt, huh...\c\nPokémon with this Ability can use\nmoves on targets regardless\r\nof their Abilities.\c
Eggs don't have Abilities!\c
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Text File : 397
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
A Normal-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against only\nFighting-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Fighting-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Fighting-, Flying-,\nand Psychic-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Flying-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Rock-, Electric-, and\nIce-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Poison-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Ground- and\nPsychic-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Ground-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Fighting-, Water-,\nGrass-, and Ice-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Rock-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Ground-, Steel-,\nWater-, Grass-, and Fighting-type\r\nattacks.\c\nBecause it's weak against many types,\na Trainer has to plan for it.\c
A Normal- and Bug-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Flying-, Rock-,\nand Fire-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Ghost-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against only\nDark-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Steel-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Ground-, Fire-,\nand Fighting-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Fire-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Fighting-, Ground-,\nRock-, and Water-type attacks.\c
A Normal- and Water-type Pokémon...\c\nIt's weak against Fighting-, Grass-,\nand Electric-type attacks.\c

There are five Battle Formats.\c\nSingle Battle is for two Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\c\nEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\c\nDouble Battle is for two Trainers\nwith two or more Pokémon each.\c\nEach Trainer will send out two\nPokémon to battle at a time.\c\nTriple Battle is for two Trainers\nwith three or more Pokémon each.\c\nEach Trainer puts three Pokémon\ninto battle at one time.\c\nRotation Battle is for two Trainers.\nEach Trainer sends three Pokémon\r\ninto battle, with one Pokémon in front\r\nand the other two in back.\c\nMulti Battle is for four Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\c\nEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\c
You may trade your Pokémon with\nother players.\c\nMeeting new people could be a\nshortcut to meeting rare Pokémon!\c
                                                                                                                                                   
In a Spin Trade, each participant brings\nan Egg to trade with others.\c\nWhich Egg will you end up with?\nWhat kind of Pokémon is in that Egg?\r\nIt's quite exciting and fun!\c\nUp to five players can take part,\nso try it with your friends!\c
You may get together with others\nand draw.\c\nYou all work on one sheet\nof paper at the same time.\c\nI'm sure a drawing made by friends\nwill be a memorable masterpiece!\c\nUp to five players can take part,\nso try it with your friends!\c
You can chat with other people\nby selecting “CHAT" in the menu.\c\nGo out and meet other players in\nthe Union Room!\c\nLet people know what you're like\nand what you'd like to do.\c\nMingle, chat, and add to your\ncircle of friends!\c

For some time after its birth, it\ngrows by gaining nourishment from\nthe seed on its back.
When the bud on its back starts\nswelling, a sweet aroma wafts to\nindicate the flower's coming bloom.
After a rainy day, the flower on\nits back smells stronger. The\nscent attracts other Pokémon.
The fire on the tip of its tail is a\nmeasure of its life. If healthy,\nits tail burns intensely.
In the rocky mountains where\nCharmeleon live, their fiery\ntails shine at night like stars.
It is said that Charizard's fire\nburns hotter if it has\nexperienced harsh battles.
It shelters itself in its shell\nthen strikes back with spouts of\nwater at every opportunity.
It is said to live 10,000 years.\nIts furry tail is popular as a\nsymbol of longevity.
The jets of water it spouts from\nthe rocket cannons on its shell\ncan punch through thick steel.
It releases a stench from its red\nantenna to repel enemies. It\ngrows by molting repeatedly.
A steel-hard shell protects its\ntender body. It quietly endures\nhardships while awaiting evolution.
It loves the honey of flowers and\ncan locate flower patches that\nhave even tiny amounts of pollen.
It eats its weight in leaves every\nday. It fends off attackers with\nthe needle on its head.
While awaiting evolution, it\nhides from predators under\nleaves and in nooks of branches.
Its best attack involves flying\naround at high speed, striking with\npoison needles, then flying off.
It is docile and prefers to avoid\nconflict. If disturbed, however,\nit can ferociously strike back.
It flies over its wide territory in\nsearch of prey, downing it\nwith its highly developed claws.
By flapping its wings with all its\nmight, Pidgeot can make a gust of\nwind capable of bending tall trees.
It searches for food all day. It gnaws\non hard objects to wear down its fangs,\nwhich grow constantly during its lifetime.
With its long fangs, this surprisingly\nviolent Pokémon can gnaw away\neven thick concrete with ease.
It flaps its small wings busily to\nfly. Using its beak, it searches\nin grass for prey.
It has the stamina to fly all\nday on its broad wings. It\nfights by using its sharp beak.
It sneaks through grass without\nmaking a sound and strikes\nunsuspecting prey from behind.
The pattern on its belly is for\nintimidation. It constricts foes\nwhile they are frozen in fear.
It occasionally uses an electric\nshock to recharge a fellow Pikachu\nthat is in a weakened state.
Its tail discharges electricity into\nthe ground, protecting it from\ngetting shocked.
It digs deep burrows to live in.\nWhen in danger, it rolls up its\nbody to withstand attacks.
The spikes on its body are made\nup of its hardened hide. It rolls up\nand attacks foes with its spikes.
While it does not prefer to fight,\neven one drop of the poison it\nsecretes from barbs can be fatal.
When it senses danger, it raises\nall the barbs on its body. These\nbarbs grow slower than Nidorino's.
Its entire body is armored with\nhard scales. It will protect the\nyoung in its burrow with its life.
It scans its surroundings by\nraising its ears out of the grass.\nIts toxic horn is for protection.
It has a violent disposition and\nstabs foes with its horn, which\noozes poison upon impact.
One swing of its mighty tail can\nsnap a telephone pole as if it were\na matchstick.
On nights with a full moon, Clefairy\ngather from all over and dance.\nBathing in moonlight makes them float.
Their ears are sensitive enough to hear\na pin drop from over a mile away,\nso they're usually found in quiet places.
As each tail grows, its fur becomes\nmore lustrous. When held, it feels\nslightly warm.
Each of its nine tails is imbued\nwith supernatural power, and it\ncan live for a thousand years.
Looking into its cute, round eyes makes\nit start singing a song so pleasant\nlisteners can't help but fall asleep.
Its fine fur feels so pleasant,\nthose who accidentally touch it\ncannot take their hands away.
It does not need eyes, because it\nemits ultrasonic waves to check\nits surroundings while it flies.
Flitting around in the dead of night,\nit sinks its fangs into its prey and\ndrains a nearly fatal amount of blood.
It often plants its root feet in the\nground during the day and sows\nseeds as it walks about at night.
The honey it drools from its mouth\nsmells so atrocious, it can curl\nnoses more than a mile away.
Its petals are the largest in the\nworld. As it walks, it scatters\nextremely allergenic pollen.
Mushrooms named tochukaso grow\non its back. They grow along\nwith the host Paras.
A mushroom grown larger than the\nhost's body controls Parasect.\nIt scatters poisonous spores.
Its big eyes are actually clusters\nof tiny eyes. At night, its kind is\ndrawn by light.
It flutters its wings to scatter\ndustlike scales. The scales leach\ntoxins if they contact skin.
A Pokémon that lives underground.\nBecause of its dark habitat, it is\nrepelled by bright sunlight.
Its three heads move alternately,\ndriving it through tough soil to\ndepths of over 60 miles.
It is nocturnal in nature. If it\nspots something shiny, its eyes\nglitter brightly.
A very haughty Pokémon. Among\nfans, the size of the jewel in its\nforehead is a topic of much talk.
When headaches stimulate its brain\ncells, which are usually inactive,\nit can use a mysterious power.
When its forehead shines mysteriously,\nGolduck can use the full extent\nof its power.
It lives in treetop colonies.\nIf one becomes enraged, the whole\ncolony rampages for no reason.
It grows angry if you see its eyes\nand gets angrier if you run. If you\nbeat it, it gets even madder.
Extremely loyal to its Trainer, it will\nbark at those who approach the Trainer\nunexpectedly and run them out of town.
The sight of it running over 6,200 miles\nin a single day and night has captivated\nmany people.
Its skin is so thin, its internal\norgans are visible. It has trouble\nwalking on its newly grown feet.
The spiral pattern on its belly\nsubtly undulates. Staring at it\ngradually causes drowsiness.
With its extremely tough muscles,\nit can keep swimming in the Pacific\nOcean without resting.
Using its psychic power is such a\nstrain on its brain that it needs\nto sleep for 18 hours a day.
It stares at its silver spoon to\nfocus its mind. It emits more alpha\nwaves while doing so.
The spoons clutched in its hands\nare said to have been created by\nits psychic powers.
Though small in stature, it is\npowerful enough to easily heft and\nthrow a number of Geodude at once.
It happily carries heavy cargo to\ntoughen up. It willingly does hard\nwork for people.
Its four muscled arms slam foes\nwith powerful punches and chops\nat blinding speed.
It prefers hot and humid\nenvironments. It is quick at\ncapturing prey with its vines.
A Pokémon that appears to be a\nplant. It captures unwary prey by\ndousing them with a toxic powder.
It pools in its mouth a fluid with\na honey-like scent, which is really\nan acid that dissolves anything.
Because its body is almost entirely\ncomposed of water, it shrivels up if\nit is washed ashore.
It extends its 80 tentacles to\nform an encircling poisonous net\nthat is difficult to escape.
At rest, it looks just like a rock.\nCarelessly stepping on it will make\nit swing its fists angrily.
It rolls on mountain paths to move.\nOnce it builds momentum, no Pokémon\ncan stop it without difficulty.
Even dynamite can't harm its hard,\nboulder-like body. It sheds its hide\njust once a year.
As a newborn, it can barely stand.\nHowever, through galloping, its\nlegs are made tougher and faster.
When at an all-out gallop, its\nblazing mane sparkles, enhancing\nits beautiful appearance.
Although slow, it is skilled at\nfishing with its tail. It does not\nfeel pain if its tail is bitten.
Though usually dim witted, it\nseems to become inspired if the\nShellder on its tail bites down.
The electromagnetic waves emitted by\nthe units at the sides of its head expel\nantigravity, which allows it to float.
The stronger electromagnetic waves\nfrom the three linked Magnemite are\nenough to dry out surrounding moisture.
It can't live without the stalk it\nholds. That's why it defends the\nstalk from attackers with its life.
The brains in its two heads appear\nto communicate emotions to each\nother with a telepathic power.
When Doduo evolves into this odd\nbreed, one of its heads splits into\ntwo. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
The colder it gets, the better it feels.\nIt joyfully swims around oceans so cold\nthat they are filled with floating ice.
Its streamlined body has low resistance,\nand it swims around cold oceans at\na speed of eight knots.
Born from sludge, these Pokémon now\ngather in polluted places and increase\nthe bacteria in their bodies.
It's so stinky! Muk's body contains\ntoxic elements, and any plant will\nwilt when it passes by.
It swims backward by opening and\nclosing its two shells. Its large\ntongue is always kept hanging out.
It fights by keeping its shell\ntightly shut for protection and\nby shooting spikes to repel foes.
Born from gases, anyone would\nfaint if engulfed by its gaseous\nbody, which contains poison.
It likes to lurk in the dark and tap\nshoulders with a gaseous hand. Its\ntouch causes endless shuddering.

Opening its large mouth, it ingests\nmassive amounts of soil and creates\nlong tunnels.

Seeing its swinging pendulum can\ninduce sleep in three seconds,\neven in someone who just woke up.

Its six eggs converse using\ntelepathy. They can quickly gather\nif they become separated.

Son entraînement d'ermite lui\npermet de léviter par le seul\npouvoir de la méditation.
Le jeûne lui permet de concentrer\nson esprit au point de déceler\nl'aura de ses adversaires.
Il améliore ses réflexes en\nstimulant ses muscles grâce à\nl'électricité dans sa fourrure.

Il avale tout en une bouchée. Ses\nfollicules sécrètent des fluides\ntoxiques qui endorment l'ennemi.

Ses crocs lacèrent des feuilles\nd'acier. Il nage à 120 km/h. On\nl'appelle “tyran des mers".

Text File : 446
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Nach der Geburt nimmt es für eine\nWeile Nährstoffe über den Samen\nauf seinem Rücken auf.
Sobald die Knospe auf seinem Rücken\nein süßes Aroma abgibt, steht die\nBlüte kurz bevor.
Nach einem Regentag riecht die\nBlume auf seinem Rücken intensiver.\nDas Aroma zieht andere Pokémon an.
Lodert die Flamme auf seiner\nSchweifspitze hell, ist Glumanda gesund.
Glutexo leben in den Bergen.\nDie Flammen auf ihren Schweifspitzen\nleuchten in der Nacht wie Sterne.
Man sagt, Gluraks Feuer lodert stärker,\nwenn es harte Kämpfe überstanden hat.
Es zieht sich in seinen Panzer zurück\nund greift dann mit Wasserstrahlen\nseine Gegner an.
Man sagt, es werde 10 000 Jahre alt.\nSein buschiger Schweif ist ein Symbol\nfür langes Leben.
Der Wasserstrahl, der aus den\nWasserdüsen schießt, kann sogar\nStahlwände durchdringen.
Seine roten Antennen sondern einen\nGestank ab, der Feinde verjagt.\nEs wächst, indem es sich häutet.
Der stahlharte Panzer schützt\nseinen zarten Körper. Es wartet\ngeduldig auf seine Entwicklung.
Es liebt Blütenhonig. Es findet\nselbst Blumen, die sehr wenig\nPollen haben.
Es frisst täglich sein Gewicht in\nBlättern. Die Nadel auf seinem Kopf\ndient der Verteidigung.
Während es auf seine Entwicklung\nwartet, versteckt es sich unter\nBlättern und zwischen Ästen.
Sein bester Angriff: Schnell auf den\nGegner zufliegen, mit Giftstacheln\nzustechen und davonfliegen.
Reizt man dieses an sich gutmütige\nPokémon, wehrt es sich wütend.
Auf der Suche nach Nahrung, die es\nmit scharfen Krallen schlägt, fliegt es\ndurch riesiges Territorium.
Schlägt Tauboss mit ganzer Kraft\nseine Flügel, beugen sich selbst\ngroße Bäume durch den Windstoß.
Es strotzt vor Lebenskraft und\nkann in jeder Umgebung leben.\nEs ist extrem vorsichtig.
Es wetzt seine ständig wachsenden\nZähne an harten Dingen. Es kann\nWände aus Beton zernagen.
Im Flug schlägt es eifrig mit den\nFlügeln. Mit seinem Schnabel\nsucht es im Gras nach Beute.
Es hat genügend Ausdauer, den\nganzen Tag zu fliegen. Sein\nscharfer Schnabel dient als Waffe.
Es bewegt sich ohne einen Laut\ndurch das Gras und greift seine\nahnungslose Beute von hinten an.
Das Muster auf seinem Bauch\nschüchtert Gegner ein. Sind sie vor\nAngst erstarrt, umklammert es sie.
Es verwendet hin und wieder\nElektrizität, um ein anderes,\ngeschwächtes Pikachu aufzuladen.
Es entlädt Elektrizität in den Boden,\num sich auf diese Weise vor\nelektrischen Schlägen zu schützen.
Es lebt in trockenen Regionen mit\nwenig Regen. Es rollt sich ein,\num sich vor Gegnern zu schützen.
Es rollt sich zusammen und rollt\ndann auf Gegner zu, die durch\nseine Stacheln Schaden nehmen.
Es mag keine Kämpfe. Ein einziger\nTropfen des Gifts aus seinen\nWiderhaken hat eine fatale Wirkung.
Bei Gefahr fährt es die Widerhaken\nam Körper aus. Diese wachsen\nlangsamer als die von Nidorino.
Sein ganzer Körper ist mit harten\nSchuppen bedeckt. Es beschützt\nsein Junges mit seinem Leben.
Es untersucht die Umgebung, indem\nes die Ohren spitzt und lauscht. Sein\ngiftiges Horn schützt es.
Es ist aggressiv und greift seine\nGegner mit dem Horn an, welches\nbei Berührung Gift absondert.
Ein Schlag mit seinem gewaltigen\nSchweif kann einen Telegrafenmasten\nknicken wie ein Streichholz.
Eine Ansammlung von Piepi bei\nVollmond tanzen zu sehen,\nsoll Freude verheißen.
Es ist sehr wachsam und zeigt sich\nnur selten. Zudem verfügt es über\nein außergewöhnlich gutes Gehör.
Es beherrscht Feuerbälle.\nWährend es wächst, teilen sich seine\nsechs Schweife, um weitere zu bilden.
Seine neun Schweife sollen\nmystische Kräfte besitzen.\nEs kann tausend Jahre leben.
Sobald es mit seinen großen, runden\nAugen rollt, fängt es an, ein Lied\nzu singen und jeder schläft ein.

Die Kraft seines Kiefers ist unglaublich.\nEs kann daher aus dem Flug heraus hart\nzubeißen.
Mit seiner pflanzenähnlichen Zell-\nstruktur betreibt es Photosynthese.\nEs kämpft eigentlich nie.
Erzeugt ein Diamantstaubgestöber durch\ndas Einfrieren der Luft um sich herum.
Erwischt es auch nur ein Lüftchen\nauf die richtige Weise, kann es ohne\nFlügelschlag den Erdball umkreisen.
Ein eingefrorenes Exemplar wurde\naus 10 000 Jahre altem Erdreich\nausgegraben. Es wachte sogar auf!
Es wurde umprogrammiert, um in\naußerirdischen Dimensionen arbeiten\nzu können. Leider schlug das fehl.
Will es beschützen, streckt es seine\nEllbogen zu etwas Schwertähnlichem\nund kämpft auf wilde Art.
Es steuert drei kleine Einheiten\nmithilfe von starkem Magnetismus.\nMan nennt sie Mininasen.
Man sagt, dass es verlorene\nSeelen in seinem biegsamen\nKörper nach Hause geleite.
Friert Beute durch seinen -50 Grad\nkalten Atem ein. Es soll diese\nBeute dann heimlich ausstellen.
Es kann mit seinem Körper in\nelektrische Geräte eindringen\nund dann für Chaos sorgen.
Als Selfe flog, erlangten Menschen\ndie Fähigkeit, Probleme zu lösen.\nEs war die Geburt des Wissens.
Als Vesprit flog, lernten Menschen\nGlück und Trauer des Lebens kennen.\nDie Geburt der Gefühle.
Als Tobutz flog, erlangten\nMenschen die Entschlossenheit.\nEs war die Geburt der Willenskraft.
Ein Legendäres Pokémon aus der\nSinnoh-Region. Schlägt das Herz\nvon Dialga, läuft die Zeit normal.
Ein Legendäres Pokémon aus der\nSinnoh-Region. Mit dem Atem von\nPalkia wird das Universum stabiler.
Sein Körper besteht aus Stahl,\nhat aber aufgrund der eigenen\nTemperatur geschmolzene Stellen.
Man sagt, es habe Pokémon aus\neinem Eisberg, Felsen und Magma\nnach seinem Abbild geschaffen.
Es wurde aufgrund seines Verhaltens\nverbannt. Aus der Zerrwelt schaut es\nauf die alte Welt.
In Nächten mit zunehmendem Mond\nstreckt sich das Licht von seinem\nSchweif und wellt sich wunderschön.
Lässt sich in warmen Meeren\ntreiben, kehrt aber immer an\nden Platz seiner Geburt zurück.
Es wird mit einer wundersamen Kraft\ngeboren, die eine Bindung zu jedem\nanderen Pokémon möglich macht.
Verursacht bei in der Nähe Stehenden\nAlpträume. Dies tut es aber nur, um sich\nzu schützen.
Wird es umarmt, empfindet es\nDankbarkeit, was wiederum dazu\nführt, dass seine Blumen blühen.
Man sagt, es sei im Nichts aus\neinem Ei geschlüpft und\nhabe dann die Welt geformt.

Text File : 447

Dopo la nascita, cresce traendo\nnutrimento dal seme piantato\nsul suo dorso.

Abitava nella giungla già 100 milioni\ndi anni fa. Abbatte gli alberi che lo\nostacolano con delle testate.
Anche se si prendono a testate, due\nRampardos non vanno KO perché il loro\ncranio è molto spesso.
Ha una corazza molto spessa. Di\nconseguenza può procurarsi erba\ne bacche senza dover combattere.
Se si mettono uno di fianco all'altro\nnessun nemico riesce a passare.\nProteggono così i loro cuccioli.
Anche se dove nasce non ci sono\nmateriali per fare bozzoli, si ritrova\nsempre coperto da un manto.
Quando si evolve assorbe i materiali che\nha intorno. Per questo motivo ne\nesistono molte varianti.
Anche se ama il nettare dei fiori, non lo\nraccoglie. Preferisce rubarlo ai Combee.
Il trio è insieme dalla nascita. È sempre\nimpegnato a portare il nettare dei fiori\na Vespiquen.
Rilascia vari feromoni per farsi obbedire\ndalle larve che trasporta mentre\ncombatte.
Talvolta due esemplari si sfregano\nle guance per condividere l'elettricità\nimmagazzinata.
Usa le sue due code come eliche per\nspostarsi nell'acqua e con esse taglia\nanche le alghe che s'impigliano.
Si vede spesso vicino ai porti dove\nsi pesca. Porta in salvo le persone\ne trascina via le prede.
La pallina, oltre a contenere sostanze\nnutritive, è molto gustosa. Starly\ncerca spesso di beccarla.
Quando splende il sole, ama aprire\ni suoi petali per assorbire i raggi\nsolari con tutto il corpo.
Se si esercita una forte pressione\nsul suo corpo, ne fuoriesce un\nmisterioso liquido viola.
In passato portava sulla schiena\nun robusto carapace. Ne rimangono\ntracce nelle sue cellule.
È talmente abile nel maneggiare gli\noggetti con le sue due code che\nsolo raramente usa le mani.
Fluttua qua e là senza motivo e per\nquesto una leggenda lo definisce\n“Guida degli spiriti vaganti".
Al tramonto, gruppi di Drifblim si fanno\ntrascinare dal vento. Se avvistati,\nscompaiono all'improvviso.
Le sue orecchie sono sempre arrotolate.\nPuò estenderle con forza per\ndistruggere qualsiasi cosa.
Ha delle orecchie molto delicate. Se le si\ntocca con forza, scalcia con le sue\ngraziose gambe.
I suoi versi sembrano incantesimi. Pare\nche a volte contengano un potere che\nporta felicità.
Se emette un verso profondo, molti\nMurkrow accorrono all'istante.\nÈ detto “Evocatore della notte".
Se l'Allenatore non gli dà da mangiare,\ngli graffia il naso. È un'abitudine che\ncerca di nascondere.
Si fascia la vita con le code per apparire\npiù grande. Fissa con insistenza chi\nincrocia il suo sguardo.
Ha una sfera nella gola. Quando saltella,\nla sfera si muove emettendo dei trilli.
Emette un fluido puzzolente dal\nposteriore. Il tanfo si sparge per 2 km\ne tiene lontani i Pokémon.
Attacca spruzzando un fluido puzzolente\ndalla punta della coda. Gli attacchi\ndall'alto lo confondono.
Secondo alcuni ricercatori, in passato\nquesto Pokémon rifletteva come\nuno specchio.
Può portare pioggia aprendo portali\nverso un altro mondo. Si pensava\nche propiziasse i raccolti.
Ama i luoghi aridi. Quando regola\nl'umidità del corpo sembra che pianga.
Imita i movimenti e le espressioni\ndi coloro che vede per capire\ni sentimenti degli altri.
Gli piace trasportare una piccola roccia.\nA volte cammina tra i piedi degli altri,\nfacendoli inciampare.
La sua lingua è uguale a quella degli\nuomini. Gli riesce quindi facile imitare\nla voce umana.
A causa del suo comportamento molesto\nè stato imprigionato in una Roccianima\ncon un incantesimo.
Attacca con la sua enorme bocca. È\nforte, ma molto maldestro e spesso\nsi danneggia da solo.
Adora gli oggetti luccicanti. Va a caccia\ndi tesori nelle grotte e li trasporta\nnel suo nido.
Si dice che quando vola, le sue ali creino\nraffiche di vento in grado di abbattere\ngli alberi vicini.
Il suo insaziabile appetito gli fa spesso\ndimenticare di avere del cibo nascosto\nsotto il pelo.
È in grado di vedere emozioni come rabbia\ne gioia sotto forma di onde. Si tratta di\nun potere unico.
Se ben addestrato, Lucario riesce a\nidentificare e a percepire le emozioni\ndi creature lontane 1 km.
Chiude le narici e poi si sposta\nattraverso la sabbia. Vive in gruppi\ndi 10.
Si infuria molto facilmente. Per mostrare\nla sua forza tiene la bocca spalancata.
Rilascia veleno dagli artigli sulla coda.\nPuò resistere senza cibo per un anno.
Dotato di una costituzione robusta, va\norgoglioso della sua forza e abbatte\ni nemici senza usare tossine.
Combatte spesso slealmente, ma lo fa per\nsopravvivere. È molto apprezzato come\nmascotte.
Ha una sacca di veleno sulla gola. Quando\ngracida il veleno si rimescola, diventando\npiù efficace.
Si attacca agli alberi nelle paludi.\nAttrae le prede con il dolce aroma della\nsaliva e poi le ingoia.
La linea che contorna il suo corpo\nimmagazzina la luce solare. Di notte\nsi illumina di una luce splendente.
Si sposta sui fondali con le lunghe pinne\nanteriori. Lanturn è suo rivale nella\nricerca del cibo.
Vengono organizzate escursioni per\nvedere questo Pokémon giocare in\nmezzo alle onde con Remoraid.
Gli uomini lo incuriosiscono molto. Si\nraduna in gruppi attorno alle impronte\nsulle montagne innevate.
Appare quando sbocciano i fiori invernali.\nQuando i petali cadono si ritira in luoghi\nsconosciuti.
L'evoluzione lo ha reso ancora più\nsubdolo. Comunica incidendo segni\nnei massi.
Alcuni hanno provato a farlo evolvere\nartificialmente, ma l'esperimento non\nè andato a buon fine.
La sua lunga lingua è sempre umida.\nLa saliva contiene un solvente che\ncausa intorpidimento.
Può gettare una roccia che tiene in\nmano come un missile contraendo ed\nestendendo velocemente i muscoli.
I suoi arti sono composti da liane che\nsi avvinghiano agli oggetti. Se tagliati\nricrescono subito.
Incurante degli attacchi nemici, si\navvicina, tocca il nemico con le code e\nrilascia una scarica elettrica.
Spara palle di fuoco di oltre 2000°C e\nil corpo assume una tinta bianca a causa\ndel calore intenso.
La sua natura lo rende affine alle\npersone che rispettano i diritti altrui\ned evitano conflitti inutili.
La forza della sua mascella è incredibile.\nTrancia i nemici mentre vola\na grande velocità.
Rifugge le lotte. Ha una struttura\ncellulare simile a quella delle piante,\nperciò usa la fotosintesi.
Modificando la temperatura del corpo,\ncongela l'aria e crea folate di cristalli\ndi ghiaccio.
Se incontra una corrente d'aria, anche\ndebole, riesce a sorvolare il globo senza\nmai sbattere le ali.
Un esemplare congelato risalente a\n10.000 anni fa si è risvegliato tra\nlo stupore generale.
È stato riprogrammato per il lavoro in\ndimensioni sconosciute, ma pare non\nfunzionare correttamente.
Quando protegge qualcuno estende\ni gomiti come se fossero spade e\ncombatte furiosamente.
Controlla tre piccole unità, dette\nMininasi, usando la forza magnetica.
Si dice che accolga gli spiriti smarriti\nnel suo corpo flessibile per riportarli\na casa.
Congela le prede con un alito glaciale\na -50°C. Si dice che poi le metta\nsegretamente in mostra.
Il suo corpo elettrico può introdursi\nin alcuni apparecchi, prendendone\nil controllo e creando caos.
Al volo di Uxie, gli uomini impararono\na risolvere i problemi. In tal modo\nnacque la conoscenza.
Al volo di Mesprit, gli uomini conobbero\nle gioie e i dolori della vita. In tal modo\nnacquero le emozioni.
Al volo di Azelf, gli uomini impararono\nla determinazione nelle azioni. In tal\nmodo nacque la volontà.
Pokémon leggendario della regione di\nSinnoh. Si dice che il tempo scorra al\nbattere del suo cuore.
Pokémon leggendario della regione di\nSinnoh. Si dice che lo spazio diventi\npiù stabile al suo respiro.
Il suo corpo è fatto d'acciaio. Tuttavia,\nin alcune parti è sciolto a causa del suo\nstesso calore.
Si dice che abbia creato dei Pokémon\nsimili a sé usando una montagna\nghiacciata, rocce e magma.
È stato bandito per la sua violenza.\nOsserva il vecchio mondo in silenzio\ndal Mondo Distorto.
Nelle notti di quarto di luna, l'aurora\ndella sua coda si spande e ondeggia\nin modo splendido.
Si sposta nei mari caldi. Torna sempre\ndove è nato, anche se si trova molto\nlontano.
Dispone di un potere innato che lo fa\nlegare con qualsiasi specie di Pokémon.
Per proteggersi, riempie di incubi\nla mente di chi gli sta intorno.\nTuttavia, non è di indole malvagia.
I fiori che lo ricoprono sbocciano se\nviene abbracciato con affetto e\nsi sente apprezzato.
Si dice che sia nato da un uovo in mezzo\nal nulla e che poi abbia dato origine\nal mondo.
